author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1705775106}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075202999', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1697828744}
review:
I'm not saying it's wrong to make a game like this but I am saying it's wrong to make it this slow and make the audio this grating. 

I will say the music pairs surprisingly well with Miles Davis - Live (with John Coltrane), or at least with the track Fran Dance anyway

I'm on level 20 of 120 and I already feel like it's been too long without having to pick up anything new. Compare this to Snakebird or The Witness or She Dreams of Caterpillars or A Good Snowman is Hard to Build or Jelly No or Baba is You or Recursed or Tis 100 or Stephen's Sausage Roll or really any good puzzle game and this just falls flat. 

"but this isn't supposed to be a challenging puzzle game, this is supposed to be meditative" idk man just go meditate. I've played much better "meditative" games. Most recently The Ramp did it for me.

far too often I've only one option in this, it's either going forward or going backward and obviously backwards isn't progression. What's the point in asking if there's only one anwser? this aint nothin bruh

author: {'steamid': '76561198087152201', 'num_games_owned': 1541, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1696938554}
review:
[h1] "Фокус" [/h1]

[u][b]Головоломка с иллюзией перспективы и стильным красным кубиком, перекатывающемся по серебристым граням.[/b] [/u]

Главной фишкой игры является перспектива фигур, по которым двигается ваш кубик, с целью того, чтобы "загнать" его в квадратный отсек такого же цвета. И это оказалось очень даже интересно.

Изначально, нас встречает ровная плоскость, на которой у нас не будет выбора, как кроме пойти прямиком к концу уровня.
Далее нам дают сделать не один, а 3 хода для прохождения, что также не доставляет трудностей и тд. - это и будет являться вашим обучением, в понимании того где вы находитесь и как бороться с этой механикой.

Уровни будут увеличиваться по сложности в геометрической прогрессии, поэтому, раньше времени вас никто не кинет "тонуть" в том, к чему вы бы еще не были готовы. Но есть интересный нюанс, то что ближе к середине уровней, коих здесь аж 120!, будут попадаться и более простые, нежели предыдущие, но лично я, увидел это как "отдых" между более тяжелыми уровнями и было приятно вернуться в более спокойные условия из начала прохождения, хотя бы на время. То, что для вас казалось тяжелым на первых порах, оказалось "отдыхом" на более поздних. 

Скорее всего, изначально вы будете проходить уровни посредством "прогулки" по карте, в надежде на то, что однажды вы набредете на финиш, и к слову, таким способом, скорее всего возможно пройти абсолютно все уровни. Тем не менее, в определенный момент начинает надоедать "попадать пальцем в небо" и хотите вы этого или нет, но вы начнете более детально изучать каждый ваш следующий или же ближайшую комбинацию ходов, перед тем, как пустить ваш кубик устремляться к финишу.

По скольку в игре 120! уровней, этот проект даст вам полностью собой насладиться и окончательно прочувствовать эту замечательную механику, так еще и под приятную мелодию и звуковое сопровождение ваших движений, которая не будет вам надоедать, а наоборот будет способствовать снятию напряжения и погружать вас в атмосферу неизведанных троп.

Для совсем ненасытных, присутствует редактор уровней, в котором вы сможете создать тот уровень, который вы сами посчитаете идеальным в этой вселенной.  Ну и соответственно вы можете испытать поделки других пользователей, если сможете добыть код, который перенесет вас на этот уровень. А также, есть бесконечный режим, в котором вам предстоит проходить на время случайно сгенерированные уровни, дабы получить как можно больше очков и занять лидирующие строчки в таблице лидеров. Так что, в этой игре вам определенно будет чем заняться!

Удачи вам в изучении этого трехмерного мира!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006800502', 'num_games_owned': 1995, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1689790857}
review:
Si je devais donner une note un peu moins binaire, je dirais "ouais, bof".

En fait, le jeu en soi n'est pas mauvais, mais il est fait pour être joué en toute petites sessions, car on overdose très vite.

C'est un jeu très peu ambitieux. Pendant 120 niveaux (Dieu merci, il ne faut en faire que 99 pour avoir tous les succès), on nous demande les mêmes choses : déplacer un cube sur une forme donnée et jouer avec les perspectives de la 3D.

C'est rigolo 5 minutes, sauf que ça manque cruellement de deux choses : d'innovation dans le gameplay (outre les formes qui changent, c'est le même concept sans arrêt, sans aucune innovation) et de challenge (par exemple, réussir en un minimum de coup).

Bon, pour ce dernier point, je suis content qu'ils ne l'aient pas mis, car j'aurais du rejouer des niveaux, et franchement, à part sur des sessions de 5 min max, ce jeu lasse très vite...

review: I am a fan of optical illusions. The fact people can make these mind-defying structures is astonishing enough, but to prioritize the sides of the structures for a puzzle game? Even better. I love the moments I had of pure frustration when some ends didn't meet where I thought they would. It really made my brain a mess (in a good way).

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3232, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1657541815}
review:
Hocus, M.C. Escher çizimleri ve imkansız şekiller üzerine kurulu minimal bir perspektif illüzyonlu bulmaca oyunudur. Geliştiricileri Yunus Ayyildiz ve Sho Ohhira, yayıncısı ise Yunus Ayyildiz'dir. Oyun 18 Kasım 2015'te piyasaya sürülmüştür.

Oyunda "Highscore mode" adı verilen yapay zeka ile oynama modu bulunmaktadır. Ayrıca, 120 zekice tasarlanmış bölüm ile oyunculara meydan okunuyor. Oyuncular ayrıca kendi seviyelerini bir kart veya kod olarak oluşturabilir ve paylaşabilirler.

Hocus, minimal tasarımı ve M.C. Escher'in çizimlerini kullanarak ilginç bir oyun deneyimi sunuyor. Oyunun zorluk seviyesi zamanla artıyor, bu da oyuncuların zihinsel sınırlarını zorlamalarını sağlıyor. Ayrıca, oyuncuların kendi seviyelerini oluşturması ve paylaşması, oyunun yeniden oynanabilirliğini artırıyor.

Bütün bu faktörler göz önüne alındığında, Hocus, zeka oyunları sevenler için ilginç bir seçenek olabilir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151383683', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1677944041}

author: {'steamid': '76561198192775938', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3428, 'last_played': 1676543764}
review: Fun game, with plenty of tricky puzzles! The puzzle-creation and sharing leave something to be desired; it would definitely be easier to share and play others' puzzles if it'd been integrated with the Steam Workshop or at least something other than sharing a code or "card" (I still don't get these) with specific people. But for the fully single-player aspect, it's pretty decent and worth it for the novelty of the escheresque puzzles. There's no windowed mode, which is frustrating, and I don't normally use in-game sound, so I can't tell you how that is, if those are important to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561199208236429', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1674733956}
review: It occurred to me while playing that most of the levels made me realize that there are so many possibilities that you can utilize and ever wonder where they will take you, some may be dead ends and some may have more options, when you have chosen your own path. You can succeed along the way, even if unintentionally when you don't look carefully. I guess it would be like seeing your own destiny, wondering aimlessly, as if you're looking for something and hoping to fully understand what's ahead of you. Some of the levels you may encounter may seem easier to understand what you have to go through, perhaps you know what you are doing and suddenly one small mistake can lead you to a dead end, consciously you have to repeat your steps and figured out what went wrong with your choice, does it sound familiar by now? Anyways, that was something I kept contemplating about, the games's good, made me lose some brain cells.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388606792', 'num_games_owned': 2246, 'num_reviews': 678, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1673475107}
review: Simple puzzle game where your goal is to move your cube to a hole. The game is pretty confusing at times in a good way. It would be nice if there were more achievements but other than that I had fun playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124470812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1672985972}
review: 3차원 모순을 활용한 퍼즐입니다. 상자를 옮겨서 원하는 곳에 가져다 놓는 퍼즐인데, 깔끔한 그래픽과 조작감으로 플래이 할 맛이 나는 게임이네요~ 난이도가 갈 수록 높아지긴 하는데, 120단계까지 있어서 양이 엄청 많아요. 플레이 타임은 다깨면 적어도 2시간은 나올겁니다! 근데 뭔가 퍼즐이 '와 이거다!' 라기 보다는 '어 뭐야 깨졌네' 느낌으로 진행되긴 해요..ㅋㅋ 브금이나 상자 옮길 때 뽁뽁 소리가 좋네요. 막 재밌는 편은 아니라서 세일할 때 구매하기 좋은 퍼즐 게임입니다. 워낙 싸니까 퍼즐게임 좋아하시는 분들께 추천해요~

author: {'steamid': '76561198350997598', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1683543049}
review:
3.4 小时通了 99 关全成就，后面还有 21 关。

+ 从《纪念碑谷》时期就喜欢这类视错觉游戏。
+ 创意很好。灵感本身不算新奇，但能实现出来不容易。
+ 轻量级，不费脑。大部分关卡试着试着就过了，最多稍微推几步，适合和人聊天或者上课摸鱼时玩。

- 这类游戏的通病，成长性差。关卡并不是越往后越难，也没有其他玩法上的创新。
- 本质是简单的图上搜索问题，状态空间也非常小。如果编程求解甚至不用考虑复杂度，因此通关并不会带来太大的成就感。

author: {'steamid': '76561198080221863', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1663924905}
review:
This game suffers immensely from "ported mobile game syndrome". It is such a direct port, that there isn't even an exit option in the menu, because the game expects you to tap the home button and yeet the app from the "active apps" drawer.

I really like the stylistically clean look and the M.C.Escher - es que puzzle design, but the formula becomes quite boring after about 20 levels. Most levels are solvable by randomly/ systematically clicking yourself through your movement options. The ones that are harder though, tend to get more entertaining though, as you are trying to reverse engineer your way to the end. Another problem is, that the difficulty curve looks like a seismogram. It is just all over the place and there is no difficulty ramp whatsoever.

Works great on Steam Deck, I guess.

I would probably not directly recommend this game, unless you want to kill some time (in that case: read a book or something) or you play it in order to fall asleep (in which case also: read a book!). The idea cool, but looses it's novelty factor really quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027047516', 'num_games_owned': 2313, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1620933657}
review:
This review is specially made for those who like to get all the achievements and have this game in their backlog (minor spoilers ahead).

[b]Description:[/b]  
Hocus is a puzzle game that’s hard to describe, but, just like the works of MC Escher, you move a cube from the front , back and sides of 3D impossible geometric objects using perspective/optical illusions.   

[b]Achievements:[/b]  
[b]How many:[/b] 4 Achievements, all are obtained by finishing the game.
[b]How much time:[/b] Around 12 hours, without a guide.
[b]Game difficulty:[/b] Normal, sometimes it’s hard to figure out how to move the cube from one side to the side of the goal, so it will require some trial and error until you find the solution. Guides are available.
[b]Achievements’ Difficulty:[/b] Easyl. You only need to finish all the levels.

[b]Overall opinion:[/b]  
I recommend this game if you like logic puzzle games. Completing the levels requires strategic thinking and persistence. Sometimes, starting from the goal, and backtracking until the starting point can help.


[b]Join and follow my group Ribbon Hunters for more suggestions and reviews of easy indie games to get all the achievements:[/b]  https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42556190-Ribbon-Hunters/

author: {'steamid': '76561198885180180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1653589182}
review:
It's a fun game for a low price.
The game has totally 65 levels, and all those have low difficulty. You can track the right way before any movement, or just move randomly until you find the right way in few minutes; it's up to you. This game can be a nice relaxing experience if you don't mind the ubiquitous optical illusion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241278520', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1654443277}
review:
Hocus to gra puzzlowa z iluzją perspektywy, bazowana na niemożliwych kształtach.

PLUSY:
+ Gra że jest prosta, to i tak jest bardzo trudna przez swoją iluzje.
+ Pierwsza gra z użyciem iluzji perspektywy (Którą jak na razie widziałem)
+ Cena, adekwatna do tego co dostaniemy. (Chociaż dałbym trochę więcej)

MINUSY:
- Jak na razie nie ma.

Grę mogę polecić, jest to bardzo dobra gra logiczna, przy której można się pomęczyć a nawet i bardzo, i jest ona tak na 2-4h mniej więcej. i jak za tą cene dałbym ocene 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561199217147146', 'num_games_owned': 1177, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1650412109}
review:
Bölüm tasarımlarında hayranı olduğum, Matematiği resmeden adam olarak anılan Hollandalı ressam Maurits Cornelis Escher'in eserlerinden ilham alınmış olan tatlı mı tatlı bir bulmaca oyunu. Bulmaca oyunu sevenlere hoşlarına gideceğine emin olduğum için, bulmaca oyunlarıyla çok haşır neşir olmayan insanlara ise fiyatından ve yorucu/zorlayıcı olmayan tasarımından dolayı giriş yapmaları için tavsiyemdir

İndirimsiz hali bile simit fiyatına denk olduğu ve bu minik fiyatının hakkını kat be kat verdiği için gönül rahatlığıyla alabilirsiniz

author: {'steamid': '76561198025427208', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1647232151}
review:
This game is the answer, assuming the question was, "What if M.C. Escher had been a game designer?"  The music is great, keeps you relaxed while you try to see things in four dimensions, basically.  The puzzles are fair and solvable with a bit of hit and miss if worse comes to worst.

Primary quibble: volume control, please.  'On' and 'Off' really just doesn't cut it.  I'm a late night person and I don't want to have to change the master volume on my PC so I can game with sound at night.

Otherwise, [b]recommended[/b].

author: {'steamid': '76561198116102695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1639999312}
review:
All Puzzleバンドル――本作「hocus」にPuzzlement、VOIを加えたパズルゲームのバンドルをセール時に１８３円で購入。本作は二度の価格改定を行っており、ついに１００円もかからずに買えるようになった。２０２１年になっても定期的にセールを行っているようなので、極めて安価に手に入れられるはず。

パズルの内容は紹介動画を見た方が早いので省略させてもらう。ボリュームは、二度の無料アップデートにより発売当初より増え、軽めのパズルが１２０問。３時間～６時間ほど遊べるだろう。パズルには手数制限がなく、出題時に戻すことも少し手間がかかるもののできるので、分からなくなったら適当に動かしながら感覚的に答えることもできる。言語のサポートに「日本語」は含まれていないが、言語依存している部分はほぼなく、オプションで使われている英語も簡単なモノなので、問題ないと思われる。Steam実績、Steamトレーディングカードに対応。プレイ中にEscキーを押すことでウィンドウ化できる。ゲームの終了は、Altキー＋F4キーを押すか、ウィンドウ化した後に右上端の×をクリックすることでできる。

残念な点は、音の設定がON／OFFの二択だけで音量が弄れないこと。Steamクラウドに非対応なこと。

トータルとして、安価であることも踏まえてオススメできる。
All Puzzleバンドル内でのおすすめ順位は、１位「VOI」、２位本作「hocus」、３位「Puzzlement」。

review: Fun perspective puzzle game - but odd.  In my case, I went through  the first 20 levels with minimal issues - got stuck on 21, which I tried on and off for a month or two.  Just contemplating removing hocus from my box and tried it one last time - and got fixed it and have plugged away and now on 45.  As with other puzzles it just has to jell in your brain for awhile.  It is a nice chill game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796851430', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 3718, 'playtime_forever': 7917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7917, 'last_played': 1645178225}
review:
《Hocus》以其独特的视觉错觉艺术和精巧的解谜设计，带给玩家一场充满挑战与惊喜的立体空间探索体验。这款游戏凭借其极简主义美学和深入骨髓的创新玩法，迅速俘获了广大益智游戏爱好者的心。

游戏的核心玩法巧妙地利用了三维空间的视觉欺骗原理，玩家在游戏中扮演一个灵动的红色立方体，通过旋转视角、调整路径，穿越一系列看似不可能的几何迷宫，最终目标是将立方体引导到对应颜色的凹槽中。每个关卡都像是一个精心设计的微型世界，看似简单的布局实则隐藏着复杂的逻辑和意想不到的解决方案，每一步移动都需要精确判断和空间想象能力。

游戏的画面设计堪称匠心独运，淡雅的灰色背景搭配明亮的几何元素，既突出了视觉错觉的魔力，又确保了长时间游玩下的舒适度。音乐与音效亦是锦上添花，它们平缓而富有节奏，为这场思维冒险增添了几分宁静与神秘感。

值得一提的是操作极其直观易懂，不论是新手玩家还是经验丰富的解谜老手，都能快速上手并沉浸其中。随着关卡难度逐渐升级，玩家将会面临更加复杂的谜题，但正是这种循序渐进的挑战性，促使玩家不断挖掘自身潜力，享受每一次成功破解后的成就感。

开发者Yunus Ayyildiz对细节的关注体现在游戏的每一处，例如适时出现的提示系统和流畅的触控反馈，都体现出对用户体验的极致关怀。此外，游戏偶尔举行的限时优惠活动及社区创作的自制关卡功能，更是极大地丰富了游戏的可玩性和社交互动性。

总的来说，这是一款集趣味性、艺术性和挑战性于一体的视觉解谜游戏，它不仅提供了令人耳目一新的游戏体验，还展示了独立游戏创新精神的魅力所在。无论是对益智游戏抱有热情的策略型玩家，还是寻求新鲜感官刺激的艺术探索者，都值得在收藏列表中占据一席之地。

author: {'steamid': '76561198048294572', 'num_games_owned': 3102, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1632963993}
review:
I know [url=https://stackoverflow.com/q/11828270]how to exit vim[/url] but not this game :D

[hr]

The game itself is fine, but PC port is rather lazy. There is no escape button, so I have to Alt + F4 the game to quit. I'd like to see some dark mode too, there is so much blazing whiteness on my 21:9 monitor.

Keep in mind that it's mobile first game and you can play it for free on Google Play, it'd be more natural to use swipes to control the cube.

I'll still rate it as positive because I like the idea here, it's cool you can get lost inside your own brain :D

For the much better and artistic presentation of the same idea there are gorgeous Monument Valley 1 and 2, check them out.

author: {'steamid': '76561199107280293', 'num_games_owned': 1297, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1630067092}

author: {'steamid': '76561198267056255', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1629580583}
review:
[h1] 一款让人边玩边佩服作者的游戏 [/h1] 

这是一款基于彭罗斯阶梯的几何悖论开发的游戏。
与其说越往后越难，不如说越往后越复杂，难度整体还是比较平均的。
[h1] 但是！ [/h1] 
这款游戏最牛逼的地方在于
 [b] [u] 与其琢磨通关的办法，不如思考游戏作者是如何将这些关卡“建设”出来的 [/u] [/b] 
我想，对于玩家来说，如上所述，整体难度不大，只是复杂程度的问题（复杂≠难），但是对于开发者来说，越复杂的关卡设计起来就越难，要设计通道、正确路线、误导路线、视差位置等等，这个思考量是十分巨大的。
给大神跪了Orz
我认为就冲这点，这游戏定价便宜了。

author: {'steamid': '76561199104210783', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1628990601}
review: Очень скучно. Это даже не головоломка как таковая: уровень сложности только один, кубик сам прилипает туда, куда нужно, думать почти не приходится. При этом двигается кубик о-о-о-очень медленно, раздражающе медленно. Настроить это никак нельзя. Меню кривое и тоже медленное (из-за анимации). Настолько уныло, что не играется даже через силу, даже из надежды, что станет интереснее. Возврат.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036538203', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1628785709}
review:
I have yet to clear Hocus, obviously- I only just reached shape 81- and yet I can now say I enjoy this, and recommend it.

The premise is simple. An assortment of rectangular-prism-frame shapes that borrow some edge and corner handoffs from M.C. Escher float in a serene space. We visit these shapes, and guide a red cube to a red slot. We can swipe the cube to go in a direction until it meets an edge or an intersection. The cube cannot cross an edge, directly, so we use the Escher-esque handoffs to reach different sides of the shape, circumventing the edges, and making it to the red slot.

The game recommends a game controller, but this is one mouse-and-keyboard nobody who feels often pleased. The mouse swipe that sends the box into this direction or that feels satisfying when it works, which is usually. The constructive criticism I would give the developers is to make that swipe more reliable though; sometimes it doesn't register, or goes the wrong way. Yes, they disclaimed a controller should be used- credit for honesty- but for a PC game it should be standard expectation for many customers to want to use mouse and keyboard.

Even that, however, is a relatively rare occurrence. There is no time limit, so any move made, including swipes in the wrong direction; or moves not made, such as a swipe neglecting to register, may be remedied easily with no loss.

Another opportunity for improvement is that there is no restart button. There are quite a few times traversing the shapes that a new route idea comes to mind and it would be preferred to set upon the newly-conceived course immediately. A restart button would be conducive to this. However, there is none, so to get back to the starting point one must manually guide the cube there or go back to the menu, click on the shape choice list, select the shape again. Either is time-consuming, and can take the wind out of the sails of one's cognitive enthusiasm.

---

That had to be put out of the way because I prefer to end my reviews on the note I think matters more, which is the appeal. This is a peaceful game, and a humble one; if I praise it too hard some expectation will arise that is not fair to hold Hocus to. The windchimes make for a pleasant music, that respects and might even aid the thinking that goes into this game.

Puzzle solving is generally simple enough to be doable for those of us who are between brain cells at a given time, yet complex enough to be worth the bother. I personally feel quite gratified when I see that red box sink into the slot. Much of the traversing involves going an obvious direction; The trick is finding those M.C.Escher-esque edges and corners, growing memory of how travel among them works, and devising a path backwards from the slot to the cube.

This simplicity is the basis for interesting, yet fair level designs. Combined with those windchimes this makes for a serene experience I dare think is good for the brain.

--

For good puzzling I recommend at standard price. especially with a recent (as of writing this review) update with even more levels and a possibly RNG-based shape creator. If you are still skeptical, wait for a sale to save a little pocket change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1625817951}
review:
Comme auparavant des jeux comme [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198036328736/recommended/204240][i]The Bridge[/i][/url] ou [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198036328736/recommended/556240][i]Disoriented[/i][/url], ce jeu s’amuse avec les formes impossibles notamment popularisées par Escher.

Il s’agit ici de déplacer un petit cube à travers des structures impossibles pour l’amener à l’emplacement désigné.
[i]Hocus[/i] a inspiré récemment un jeu quasiment identique : [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198036328736/recommended/1363850][i]The Impossible[/i][/url].

Les graphismes, simples et fonctionnels, permettent de jouer en ayant une vision claire de la situation.
On s’habitue assez vite à la forme particulière du jeu pour trouver le bon chemin pas trop difficilement, comme pour tous les autres labyrinthes finalement (au pire, il suffit d’expérimenter méthodiquement de faire demi-tour si nécessaire). Ca le rend accessible à un large public.

Il y a même un éditeur de niveaux mais je n’ai pas testé.


Typiquement le petit jeu simple pour passer le temps sans trop réfléchir, bercé par la musique zen. 2 à 4h de jeu selon le niveau de chacun.


Il existe un [i]Hocus 2[/i] mais jetez aussi un œil sur les autres titres du développeur Yunus Ayyildiz (gamebra.in) si vous aimez ce genre de petits jeux car il propose quelques puzzles très originaux (VOI, Puzzlement, Macdows 95…).




[quote]
[b]Pour découvrir d’autres jeux du même développeur :[/b]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198036328736/recommended/1460610/]Lire aussi mon évaluation de [i]Hocus 2[/i][/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198036328736/recommended/545690/]Lire aussi mon évaluation de [i]VOI[/i][/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198036328736/recommended/775530/]Lire aussi mon évaluation de [i]Puzzlement[/i][/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198036328736/recommended/948900/]Lire aussi mon évaluation de [i]Macdows 95[/i][/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198086192330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1620994773}
review:
Kind of boring, it's cool but not a good puzzle game. You'll often stumble upon a solution even if you're trying to think through what you're doing. It's also faster to try things at random than trying to find a path in your head. It also isn't pretty at all and the music just adds slight ambiance.

Later levels that were added at some point are way more fun imo (66th onwards) and are the reason I still recommend this.

The UI feels like a bad mobile port, which isn't an issue since you don't really have to deal with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988376070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1618524705}
review:
[b]Are you bored to tears by our ordinary tri-dimensional world?  Do you dream that our world could be different?  Have you ever dreamed of telling your teachers at school that geometry principles are "relative"? Would you like to "live" in a different reality?[/b]   Search no more my friend: THIS game is for you.  Any failure of your part is caused by your clinging onto beliefs related to a supposedly "normal" universe...

The GOOD: your optics have never been more deceptive!
The BAD: why is it so short? At the 100th puzzle, I was so enjoying myself!  :-(

author: {'steamid': '76561198254440076', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1692822565}
review:
Bölüm tasarımlarında hayranı olduğum, Matematiği resmeden adam olarak anılan Hollandalı ressam Maurits Cornelis Escher'in eserlerinden ilham alınmış olan tatlı mı tatlı bir bulmaca oyunu. Bulmaca oyunu sevenlere hoşlarına gideceğine emin olduğum için, bulmaca oyunlarıyla çok haşır neşir olmayan insanlara ise fiyatından ve yorucu/zorlayıcı olmayan tasarımından dolayı giriş yapmaları için tavsiyemdir.

İndirimsiz hali bile simit fiyatına denk olduğu ve bu minik fiyatının hakkını kat be kat verdiği için gönül rahatlığıyla alabilirsiniz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056812873', 'num_games_owned': 1135, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1612911273}
review:
[h1] Мы поломаем твое представление о мире, хочешь ты этого или нет [/h1]
Когда-то давно, в детстве, на моей старенькой PSP у меня была головоломка [u] echochrome,[/u] в которой игроку предстояло перевести человечка по прерывистой локации, которой можно было бы играть с помощью иллюзий, тем самым продвигаясь дальше и проходя уровень. И очень много лет я не видел ничего подобного. 

Прошлым же летом я обозревал игру [u] THE IMPOSSIBLE, [/u] которая не только понравилась мне разнообразными уровнями того же плана, но и философским сюжетом о судьбе искусственного интеллекта, заключенного в игру. И прямо в обсуждении обзора мне рассказали о hocus – головоломке, где хоть и нет сюжета, уровней в разы больше, а игровой процесс бросает значительно больший логический вызов и дает больше возможностей поразмыслить.
 
Ладно, закончим с и так уже затянувшимся вступлением. Наша сегодняшняя гостья, игра [u] hocus [/u], представляет из себя головоломку набором из ста уровней всецело эксплуатирующая идеи рисунков художников Мариуца Эшера и Жан Жиро, более известного как Мёбиуса, а кроме этого принципы образования так называемых невозможных фигур. 

При этом игра легко объясняет нам свои правила. У нас есть красный куб, которого нужно доставить из данной точки в другую точку переводя из плоскости в плоскость по средствам парадоксов невозможных фигур. Постепенно игра подкидывает всё более и более сложные структуры, и ближе к концу полностью оправдывает жанр головоломки, начиная с простого треугольника Пенроуза и заканчивая всё более мудрёными комбинациями. 

Помимо самих интересных уровней сама игра и её сопровождение сделаны на довольно хорошем уровне. Музыка не отвлекает, при этом расслабляя и настраивая на нужный лад, а интерфейс и однокнопочное управление не то, чтобы были сложны в понимании и освоении. 

hocus отлично подойдёт как для любителей поразмыслить, желающих попробовать что-то новое в жанре головоломок, так и для неискушенной публики. Также игра понравится коллекционерам идеальных игр, ведь прохождение не займет много времени. Лично у меня игра стоит наряду с [u] дилогией KAMI [/u] в списке легко осваиваемых и минималистичных головоломок с очень интересной идеей. Также, авторы уже долго корпят над второй частью, которую я теперь с нетерпением жду, ведь в ней они хотят вывести свою идею на совершенно новый уровень.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122428600', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1610256278}
review: hocus is a beautiful and simple puzzle game. The 100 included levels only take a few hours to complete, but they are lots of fun. The achievements unlock as levels are progressed through. The level builder also adds even more fun to the game and is very easy to use. Solid recommendation for fans of games similar to Monument Valley, fans of optical illusions and puzzles, or for fans of the artwork of M.C. Escher. Definitely worth the $0.99 price tag.

review:
Este juego es una obra de arte de la grafica, muy ingeniosos los puzzles usando la perspectiva visual en 3D para que segun como enfoquemos la vista, puedan verse las cosas de 2 formas diferentes.

Algo similar al Monument valley y otros juegos que vi, si bien no innova en ese sentido, esta muy bien hecho y se disfruta el ingenio al que hay que recurrir, me encanto.

8/10

review: Not much to say about hocus really. It's a neat little puzzle game that uses infinite shapes/penrose triangles to challenge the mind. Worth picking up if you like that sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978350645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1608517556}
review: This game taught me that Penrose triangles really aren't all that interesting. When used creatively in artwork the way Escher did? Sure. By themselves as abstract geometric forms? Not so much. There is maybe 30 minutes worth of interesting content here, but the game dragged on for hours and became a real chore to finish. And now I see that the dev is working on a sequel. Why not make a sequel to Puzzlement instead? That game was so much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103325055', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1623618839}
review:
Bedavadan biraz daha pahalı güzel ve basit bir puzzle oyunu. En alta eklediğim görsel linkinde ve mağaza görsellerinde görebileceğiniz gibi oyundaki bölümler "imkansız şekiller"den oluşuyor. Amacımız bu şekiller üzerinde A noktasından B noktasına gidebilmek. Bunu yaparken de 3 boyutlu düşünerek ufak bir beyin jimnastiği yapıyorsunuz. Bu oyunu beğenirseniz yapımcının diğer oyunlarını da bir inceleyin derim Puzzlement oldukça hoşuma gitmişti onu da tavsiye ederim. Bim çikolatası fiyatına olan bir oyunu uzun uzun anlatmaya gerek yok. Parası dert değil ama 500 tane AAA oyunum var bu oyunu oynamam derseniz Android ve iOS için de mevcut oradan da bakabilirsiniz.


https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2304224177

author: {'steamid': '76561199032663491', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1604024178}
review:
2020/10/30 도전과제 100% 달성. 

- 아무래도 뱅글뱅글 도는 게 많은 퍼즐이다보니 하다보니깐 너무 멀미가 남..

author: {'steamid': '76561198175493990', 'num_games_owned': 2383, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1603334035}
review:
[b]HOCUS[/b] é mais um puzzle minimalista, porém, faz isso de forma [b]extremamente original[/b].
Ele faz uso das formas geométricas impossíveis. Você precisa levar o bloquinho vermelho até o encaixe vermelho, só isso.
Mas... pra fazer isso você vai quebrar muito a cabeça. Você vai ter que ter uma boa noção de perspectiva. Com o tempo se acostuma pois a mecânica é sempre a mesma do começo ao fim.
A curva de aprendizado é boa, porém não há um aumento tão grande na dificuldade. Ela quase que se normaliza depois de um tempo.
A trilha sonora é boa e os efeitos sonoros são simples, porém cumprem seu papel.
[b]Nota 10![/b] Vale muito a pena.

Ponto negativo: Não tem salvamento na nuvem steam.

Quer uma dica?
[spoiler]Para facilitar, trace o caminho da base até a caixa e tente memorizar, ou seja, imagine o percurso contrário.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198438620061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1602366447}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042951349', 'num_games_owned': 764, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1598966052}
review: It is find the path, the game.  It is overly simple with no other elements with which to build any kind of meaningful challenge.  Once you get comfortable navigating its interwoven 3D environments, that's it.  Just use the same strategy that you would for the mazes on the back of cereal boxes. Without any additional complexity, the levels just drag on and on with no new ideas or even any sense of escalating difficulty.  Had this game had more mechanics, such as having to find keys to unblock paths/the exit, then you could've had a real game.  As it stands though, there are too many levels with no new ideas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079877662', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1609904523}
review: With patience you will start to understand the strange paths that lead from start to finish. Like other puzzles that mess with geometry, it can be frustrating at first, but rewards perseverance. It is fine to use with a mouse or touch-pad. The graphics are clear, so there is no danger of misunderstanding where you are. It could do with an exit control and a rewind that takes you back to start of the level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408768447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1593036442}
review:
The goals of the game is to move a block over the outer surface of a geometrical shape from the starting point to the end goal making only 90 degree turns (270 degree turns are not allowed). The twist here is that the levels consist of ever more complicated Penrose tribars, which are "impossible" 3D objects with messed-up perspective. This makes for some great geometrical puzzles, most can be solved within 1 or 2 minutes, only a few took me longer. Working "backwards" from the goal to the starting point is often easier, but requires you to imagine how you would walk over the surface of the Penrose tribar, another great way to train your brain.

My main criticism is that my XBOX controller did not work. And the ticking noises that the cube makes when moving get annoying very quickly - do not wear headphones as the ticking will drive you crazy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198989051349', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1592254794}
review: This is a simple and very cool puzzle game based off of illusions like the penrose triangle. While traversing and beating seemingly impossible shapes for 45 minutes is a cool novelty, the issue comes when the developers stretch this game to three to four hours of game and there is no story or any new mechanics that introduced and the last fifty out of hundred levels dragged on and by the end it felt like a chore to beat it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198337510160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1591612758}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197984605215', 'num_games_owned': 15312, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1590561202}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197996899722', 'num_games_owned': 1440, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1590278288}
review:
This is a lovely little brainteaser.  The levels ramp up a little in difficulty, and reach a complexity level around level 50 where brute force search can be less efficient than planning your route, which is just about perfect.

The second "half" of the game is really quite satisfying.  Each level will last you between 20 seconds and 3 minutes (ish) depending on how you approach it.  Some levels look fiendish but are deceptively easy.  

The in-game level editor is great, and shows off the "magic" behind the scenes of how the game does its stuff.

The "music" is very low key (no pun intended), just bells and tinkles.   It's very chilled, and after a while you kind of slip into a daze, just moving your little block about.

A lovely little game, and really cheap, but gives a good few hours of calming entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160278225', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 1976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1613927421}
review:
Описание:
Головоломка основанная на графических иллюзиях на 3д кубах. 
Есть статичное изображение на котором находится кубическая 3д фигура и есть 2д кубик, которым мы и управляем. 
Мы кликая мышкой задаем ему движение пока он не коснется грани, если грань переходит на другую плоскость то куб переходит туда... 
Задачей является довести куб до красной точки(бедный куб =(). В игре 100 уровней, неплохая графика и приятная не надоедающая музыка. 
Она у меня была оооочень давно в желаемом и вот наконец не поскупился и купил ключик. 
Прошёл 25 уровней и зевая выключил... 
Игра не преподносит совершенно ничего нового. 
Играешь ты в первый уровень, в двадцатый или любой другой все будет все время одинаково. 
Меняются лишь фигуры. 
Для такой игры 100 уровней это много... 
Могли вполне оставить штук 25 и выпустить 4 части... 
Ставить ли от этого негативную оценку? 
Нет конечно. 
Игра неплохая и если она приелась мне, то кто нибудь другой осилит с удовольствием все 100 уровней и скажет дайте еще... 
Рекомендую, но восторгов от игры нет.

Итог:
Головоломка с оптическими иллюзиями, загони красный кубик в лузу, катая его по граням геометрических предметов, обман зрения гранями фигур, довольно интересно, несложно при наличии развитого пространственного зрения, главное идти от противного и вовремя сменить грань, в принципе если идти от лузы можно довольно легко найти маршрут, 100 уровней, 4 ачивки за каждые 25 уровней, годная игра с расслабляющей музыкой.
Отдельно хочу отметить, красный кубик в серебристом лабиринте, очень стильно смотрится.

Моя оценка: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030202379', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1575430597}
review:
OK. This is from the maker of the excellent game VOI, as well as puzzlement and macdows95.

I have all of his games, but I've only played hocus and VOI. Neither had an actual exit button. It is very clear that these were mobile ports for PC.

That said, I am very glad that these games were brought to Steam. hocus drew me in with its Escher-like feel and minimal aesthetic, though as other reviewers have pointed out, the game is actually based on Penrose triangles.

The game is both a lot more and a lot less challenging at the same time. I was only able to beat it after I stopped thinking in the usual way, flowed with the labyrinthine level design, and watch for opportunities to get to the exit.

The level editor also adds a lot of value. The game is worth it on its own, but the level editor lets you create and share levels with others using a sort of passcode system called cards.

The wind chimes will haunt your dreams. There is no escape.

So, is it fun? Yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025089345', 'num_games_owned': 2174, 'num_reviews': 2934, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1574140030}

但是后来不明不白地就沦落成了视频的模仿者咯~

[h1]游戏很棒~建议自己慢慢玩通关~别像我~直接放弃思考变成模仿者咯~[/h1]

review: Хорошая тренировка для мозга.Сложность постепенно возрастает по ходу вашего прогресса в игре.Обман зрения,есть над чем подумать,тренировка пространственной реальности.Первые 30 уровней особых сложностей не вызывали,дальше немного призадумался.Отличная тренировка на внимание,перед тем как двигать кубик,внимательно посмотрите на конструкцию и вы обязательно найдете выход.Благодарность разработчикам за качественный продукт!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055915711', 'num_games_owned': 1034, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1562278426}
review:
[h1]Простота мысли.[/h1]

[code]Головоломки, особенно казуальные, в какой-то момент были моей страстью. Я скупал всё, что привлекало мой взор. Сейчас, понимая, какая же это была ошибка и, разгребая все эти завалы, ловлю себя на мысли, сколь мимолётна была эта любовь к минимализму и простеньким задачам. Теперь мне хочется большего, но головоломкам любой сложности и наполнения я всё так же симпатизирую. Всё очень просто - мне нравится их решать.[/code]

[b][u]Играй, только если правда этого хочешь.[/u][/b]

[b][i]hocus[/i] - это до безобразия минималистичная игра. Сейчас, как и пару лет назад, такой Путь выбирают многие разработчики. Не каждому доводится выгодно представить своё творение, выделить его среди конкурентов. Думаю, у hocus это почти получилось, потому как без проблем здесь всё равно не обошлось.

По началу головоломка кажется довольно неброской и серой, скажем так, попросту непривлекательной для масс. А на вкус? Надо пробовать. Только распробовав, понимаешь, насколько изящны и, в то же время, просты её решения. Красный кубик нарочито выделяется на фоне серых "перекладин", яро заявляя о том, на кого должно обращать внимание. Благо, здесь ещё есть на что посмотреть.

Каждый уровень - это новая фигура, которая, на первый взгляд кажется непроходимой. Наполненная оптическими иллюзиями, она пытается нас запутать. Конечно, если у вас развито пространственное зрение, то почти все головоломки покажутся вам легкой прогулкой. А если нет, то решение всё равно найдется, ведь всё построено таким образом, что вы рано или поздно разгадаете эту головоломку.

Музыкальное оформление здесь очень медитативное, приятно слуху. Звуки никак не разочаровывают. Всё очень просто и со вкусом.

Единственное, что не выдерживает проверку критикой - геймплей. То бишь, Вы можете сколь угодно долго наслаждаться тем, как выстроена фигура, пытаться высмотреть правильный путь в уме, использовав своё пространственное зрение для достижения цели, слушать приятный саундтрек... Казалось бы, всё очень даже хорошо. Но вот ведь проблема, сам процесс вызывает в течение решения скуку. Я проходил её несколько месяцев оттого, что не мог проходить более 3-4 уровней за раз. Сначала я наслаждался, получал удовольствие, а вот под конец, мне всё это просто хотелось побыстрее закончить.

В игре есть редактор уровней, чтобы Вы сами побаловались с построением фигур, если на то будет желание, но, у меня такого желания не возникло.[/b]

[code][i]hocus[/i] может вызывать  на самом деле довольно противоречивые чувства, но всё будет зависеть оттого, каким взглядом Вы изначально будете смотреть в её сторону, какими ожиданиями будет полна ваша дума. Так, наверное, со всем происходит. В любом случае, это хорошая казуальная головоломка, которая точно найдёт своего Игрока.[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198060632996', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1562533060}
review:
미로찾기처럼 역순으로 길을 찾아나서면 금방 답이 보일것 같지만 막상 해보면 그렇지 않다.
착시로 이뤄진 경로가 눈과 머리를 시험에 들게한다.
난 머리가 따라주지 않아 목적지를 추론하기 보다는 그냥 열심히 발로 뛰며 경로를 찾았다.
(게임은 클리어했지만 어떻게 길을 찾았는지는 나도 모른다. 거의 생쥐 미로찾기 수준)

그럼에도 묘한 매력이 있다. 시각적 독특함, 금속성 효과음, 느긋하게 굴러가는 큐브를 관조할 때 왠지 모를 만족감도 느낀다. 스팀의 다양한 퍼즐 가운데서도 상당히 독특한 편에 속한다. 개인적으로는 추천할만한 게임이라 생각.

아, 그리고 스팀의 많은 보드게임 형태 퍼즐 가운데 컨트롤러(패드)를 지원하는 게임은 생각보다 많지 않다. 자고로 머리쓰는 게임은 가장 편한 자세로 널부러져 플레이하는게 나름의 풍류인데, 이 게임은 다행이 컨트롤러를 지원해서 보다 느긋하게 게임을 즐길수 있었다. 이 또한 장점이라 생각.

팁을 하나 더하자면, 이 게임은 종료 및 창모드 메뉴가 없는데(아마도 스마트폰 기반 게임을 이식해서 그런듯) 게임 도중 Esc를 누르면 창모드로 바뀌고 창 끄기로 게임을 종료할 수 있다.
또 한가지 장점은, 풀스크린 모드보다 창모드에서 게임 스피드가 더 빨라진다.
왜 일까? 이유는 모르겠지만 창모드에서 여러모로 훨씬 더 쾌적한 게임 플레이가 가능하다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048735141', 'num_games_owned': 2348, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1557963935}
review:
Hocus is an interesting minimalistic game about optical illusions.

The aim of a player is to lead a red cube to a speific place of a shape - it seems to be fairy easy, but the illusion-based levels can actually be tricky. There are 100 levels of various shapes.
Playing with a gamepad makes moving the cube instinctive, but playing with a mouse is fine too. Sometimes it is not clear which way the cube can be pushed, but there is a circle above a shape that shows possible movement directions.

The gameplay is nice, though it is very repetitive and might quickly get boring. Moreover it is very hard to plan anything in this game. Passing levels is more trials and errors than puzzle analysis.

Summarizing, Hocus is not a bad game, but rather not addictive enough to finish it in one sitting.
Still, with its little price, it is worth trying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090249095', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1558753127}
review:
The definition of the word "hocus" is "to play a trick on" or "deceive", which is exactly what this game does to players. The  task of guiding a red cube through 3D mazes of gray metal bars easily becomes complicated through clever usage of optical illusions. ...So just use this playlist guide on how to get through them; you'll acquire all the Steam Achievements in a few short hours, although it would be a good idea to leave the game open for a little while longer to get all the drops for Trading Cards.

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLoi8XQWRo3pIhzRfnfe0-wvEs19h0QHuD

That being said, this game also has a few other features:

- Calming wind chime music.
- Steam Trading Cards; while the Profile Badges, profile backgrounds and emoticons are decent-looking, you'd better have a load of cash if you want to buy the cards on the Community Workshop.
- A level editor to make your own levels for sharing with other players but unfortunately, this feature just isn't worth the time because nobody plays this game for long; once all 100 levels are finished, you're pretty much done.

I suppose "hocus" is clever enough to be worth its retail price but overall a "one-and-done" game, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181526215', 'num_games_owned': 10867, 'num_reviews': 439, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1545835110}
review:
[h1][b]Chr_的喜加一游戏评测计划√[/b][/h1]

1.建议分类：
	游戏类型：【休闲/益智】
	游戏质量：【70/100】

2.评分：(+好评 -差评 =中评)
	+ 有卡
	+ UI很精致
	= 有几个成就
	= BGM海星

3.评测：
	方块版the bridge，利用空间错觉操作小方块移动到终点，简单的关卡可以试出来，难一点的试不出来可以倒推。一共有100关，靠自己的话大概要2h玩完，我通关加上挂卡一共6h。还有关卡制作器，好评！（但是没有创意工坊，遗憾），推荐打折的时候喜加一。

author: {'steamid': '76561198040751594', 'num_games_owned': 2442, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1545807189}
review:
hocus- абстрактная головоломка с невозможными лабиринтами. 

Все наверное видели эти изображения с  "невозможными" лестницами или сцену из фильма "Начало". 

А теперь вам выпадет возможность их "пощупать" в попытках довести кубик из точки А в точку В. Но учитывая местную архитектуру уровней, это будет не всегда просто.
Иногда попытки рассчитать маршрут во всех этих 4-ех измерениях никуда не приводят и спасает простое и бессмысленное блуждание по лвлу.

Но все ровно данная игра является отличной головоломкой с нестандартным подходом к построению уровней, которые заставит вас мыслить более абстрактно.

[h1] [i] Читайте ещё больше качественных обзоров в группе [/i][url=steamcommunity.com/groups/topreview]ТОП Обзор[/url][i] 
Подписывайтесь на [/i][url=store.steampowered.com/curator/32707647/]куратора[/url][/h1]

review:
착시현상을 이용한 3D미로(?)
이런 게임의 태생적 한계인데, 출구에서 부터 길을 찾으면 개쉽다.
이를 방지하기 위한 여러 기발한 아이디어가 있었으면 좋았겠지만 그런 건 역시 1도 없다.
그래도 박스 굴러가는 거 구경하며 자신의 생명을 낭비하는 기분은 꽤 즐길만 하다.

+++++

70탄 이상부터 갑자기 난이도 밸런스가 무너진다.
그냥 복잡하게만 보이고 어이없을정도로 쉽다.
마지막이 아쉬운 게임이었다.

2018년 12월 25일 완전 정복 완료.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041847294', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1533938932}
review:
[h1]Really Makes You Think[/h1]
This is less of a game and more of a Brain trainer. For the sake of this review let’s just refer to it as a game though.
I didn't really find myself having fun at any time during the Game which is why I don't consider it a game however I did find it did get my brain working which is what Braintrainers are designed to do and the reason I'm giving this a Positive review.

The Puzzles are well balanced, I didn't find them too easy to the point where I just followed a path and beat the level without having to plan out my path in some way and it wasn’t too difficult to the point where I got stuck for a long period of time or got frustrated. 
An interesting way to solve a puzzle I found was not to work forward all the time but work backwards from the spot you needed to get to. This is often not an easy task however and can confuse you even more sometimes or lead to the solution by retracing your steps in the other direction. 
This did help me many times when I got stuck and helped me close the gap on which path I needed to take. 

This is obviously a Mobile game ported to PC so keep that in mind. 
Easy to 100% achievements in this one by just completing all 100 Levels. ETA: 4 Hours playtime. 

[h1]5.7/10[/h1]
[i]- Gets your brain working and helps pass the time[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198118980661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1523845781}
review:
Hocus is an okay game in a mindless fashion, but suffers from being a blatant port from mobile with really poor PC controls. The actual puzzles are functional, but for many of them, especially the larger ones, I felt like it was more effective to just traverse at random than apply any kind of logic. This robs the levels from being satisfying to solve. Every time the cube moves a space it plays an almost metalic clinking that quickly gets annoying. The music is also uninteresting, and breifly becomes quieter each time you finish a level which is very noticable and feels discontinuous.

What really kept the game from being enjoyable were the multitude of lacking features that make it clear the game is designed for mobile and not PC. There's no options menu or exit button (you have to alt+f4). The keyboard is not used although you need it to force quit the application. The mouse dictates movement in a way that would work well for a touch screen but works poorly for a mouse. Only the direction of a click is used, the cube stops at every intersection regardless of how far you click which is perpetually aggrivating. The game recommends you play with a controller, but almost everything is reliant on solely the left thumbstick and the buttons are used poorly or not at all. While using a controller, it is also possible to enter menus that are impossible to leave (namely the level editor) and you also cannot ever exit the game. When scrolling in level selection, the screen moves in the opposite direction as to what is native for PC and the movement speed is very slow. To make all of this even worse, the game doesn't look like the screenshots in the store, rather it has a bordered region in the middle of the screen shaped like a phone screen where all of the actual gameplay takes place (pictured below).

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1362670427
The game has a level editor which seemed to work well enough, but I never felt compelled to look for community levels as I don't think any level made via the editor could bring anything new to the picture; all the provided levels rely on the same mechanic.

Steam games feeling like they're a port from mobile isn't always a fundamentally negative thing, but in this case it is. Having played many other terrific simple puzzle games like PUSH, Hook, and klocki this one was a letdown. If you're interested in this game, I would recommend instead looking at the game Disoriented, which has a nearly identical base mechanic but has a much smoother implementation that feels native to PC.

[quote]For more puzzle game and platformer recommendations,  check out [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/29932239/]my Curator page[/url][/quote]

review:
hocus is one of the most unique puzzle experiences I've encountered. At its most basic it's a maze. The mazes are small, you can see the whole maze at once, and there aren't really that many paths you could take, and yet it will still surprise you how lost you get. 

There's plenty of challenge and play time. Easily worth the mere dollar it costs.

review:
Guide your red cube to a finish point round impossible objects. 
One of the better maze games out there, you can spend time zoning out and wandering the level to happen upon the finish or really dig in and trace how the path will work to complete the levels. 

It also has a nifty way of sharing levels with virtual cards and QR codes should you want to make some impossible shapes to wander round yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198436369103', 'num_games_owned': 748, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1519268600}
review:
前言
首先：感谢STCN提供的此次游戏测试机会。


Hocus是一款关于视觉错位的游戏，类似于《纪念碑谷》，但是比其更加简约，并且少了剧情的烘托。
该游戏目前仅支持英文，估计以后也不会有中文。

介绍
这个游戏的主要内容就是控制红色的小方块从起始点通过视觉错位等方法，移动到红色的凹槽内，就像这样：

  
  

整个游戏只需要不断地点击和寻找突破口，使小方块移动，并利用视错觉进行多个面的移动，最终到达终点。因此这个游戏给我留下的第一个印象就是：极简。整个游戏就只有黑白红三种颜色，同时只有一成不变的视角和游戏模式，100个关卡中，所有关卡都是一成不变的进行移动、解谜、到达终点。因此，在游戏的后期，难免会出现枯燥、无聊的现象（整整一百个关卡啊）并且，游戏音乐极为枯燥，非视觉游戏爱好者请谨慎入手。
评测
游戏性：总体来说，这个游戏还是十分优秀的，但是，由于较为冗长的游戏内容加上千篇一律的关卡和毫无创新的玩法，使人缺少玩下去的动力，这也是这个游戏与《纪念碑谷》无法匹敌的最大的一点。当然了，这个游戏也经常给人带来通关时“柳暗花明又一村”的感觉，所以说，总体来讲还勉强说的过去。
剧情：此游戏完全没有剧情可言，这也是这个游戏较为枯燥的原因。在后面几个关卡，我经常自己问自己：我是谁？我为什么要去到红凹槽里面？？？？
BGM与音效：真不知道开发者为什么要找如此刺耳的BMG。。。。本来挺美得游戏画面，BGM可以说毁了这个游戏。。。。。当然，小方块移动的时候的声音还是十分带感、耐听的。
界面：整个界面采用极简设计，几乎没有任何文字，颜色只有黑白红三种，配上100个关卡，简直“妙不可言”。
个人总结
优点：
+较为充实的游戏内容
+通关时给人带来的成就感
+小方块移动时的音效
缺点：
-一成不变的内容和界面
-扎耳朵的BGM
-缺乏剧情的烘托
总体个人评分4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198400978118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1517772460}
review:
Great riddles (8/10)
Game with simple graphics and simple principles but its solving is often far from simple.
Only flaw is that mouse control sometimes missfire to completely diferent dirrection. Highlighting selected axis might help. Keyboard controls might be added cause it would take just 6 or 7 buttons (w/x,e/z,a/d and s-stop or 8/0,6/4,1/3 for numeric keyboard).
 Well it was lot of fun.

 It works like mix of axonometric and pile of Mobius strips. Few added rule change game so much if you try to thing about riddle as an axonometric object you get just sick or headache :D so you better think of it as system of multiple sides with connections and switching loops. Or even more simple as a maze.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168879278', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1517622978}
review:
It's a simple, fun little game to play when bored. Sometimes it gives you some kind of mindf*ck, which is something I like actually. Definitely check it out!

It starts out easy and lets you learn how to move around to get to the end but then it gets complicated. It's kind of a simple "Monument Valley". 

The minimal graphics are aesthetically pleasing, the music is soothing, controls are intuitive, and the puzzles can be challenging.

75/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198175651133', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1517248589}
review:
Got this came for free with a Steam coupon. This is casual brainteasing game based on quite a unique concept  challenging your regular perception of space and dimensions. Despite feeling my mind bended badly each time I have couple of levels finished I've completed the game. Highly recommend this nice short (made it through in some 4 hours) game for keeping your brain flexible and for opening new modes your brain can work:)
Using your gamepad makes game being played in much convenient way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287004623', 'num_games_owned': 1076, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1480296452}
review:
一开始有人要我写hocus测评的时候我是拒绝的。
因为你不能让我写，我就马上去写。
第一我要想一下，
虽然这个游戏很好玩，但是评论区全是正正经经的测评，而我是一个搞（sao）笑（hua）测评家，
我不愿意写完之后再加一些新梗上去，
然后测评duang一下，很好玩，很有趣。
这样大家一定会骂我，根本没有这样的测评，就证明我写的是假的。
后来我也经过证实这个测评是真的不好笑。
我大概想了1分钟左右，感觉游戏还不错。
后来我在写的时候也要求他们不要加特技，因为我要让大家看到，
我玩完了是这个样子[spoiler]几何成绩顶呱噶[/spoiler]
你们玩完之后也会是这个样子[spoiler]个个长得像王八[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198112866114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1514965814}
review:
Hocus is a simple puzzle game that was originally built in Adobe flash and was heavily inspired by the illusions from M.C Escher. The objective of the game is to simply move a red cube around a geometric shape until you get to the exit point. While the game was conceived in a couple of months, the development itself took 8 months in total and the brain twisting genius responsible for this was a Turkish developer named Yunus Ayyildiz https://www.linkedin.com/in/yunus-ayyildiz-a666aa99 who openly declares to be also an avid puzzle lover.

With over 100 levels and a intuitive and friendly level editor where you can make your own levels, you should be challenged and enthralled for a number of hours. Easy to pick up and control at first, it does eventually become very daunting with the later levels as you meet the perplexing shapes head on. Thankfully the Zen ambience will soften that frustration and remind you to take deep breaths.

Below are three levels I made with the level editor. 
https://youtu.be/GLJnMV3H11g

author: {'steamid': '76561198038146007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1514680213}
review: That was tough. That was really tough! You navigate a cube through 100 levels of 3D opitcal illusions. And it can get really hard. Some levels I blasted through in 10 seconds, others I spent 10 minutes on, so it varies. On quite a few occasions I just had to look up a guide because I was completely lost!  The game only cost me $.50 and I it took me 4 hours to beat, so I would say I got well over my monies worth! Definitely reccomend if you're looking for something challenging!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1513487616}
review:
パズルゲーム。
3次元の立体として成り立っていないブロック構造物上で立方体を転がしてゴールまで送るのが目的のパズルだ。全100ステージ。
仮にマップのブロックを平面に展開できるならば、ゴールまでの迷路は非常に単純なものになっていると思うが、騙し絵的な立体のために混乱させられる。少し難しいのはあるが、しばらくプレイしていれば解けるような難易度だと思う。最初から最後までやることは同じで、途中で新しいギミックが追加されたり画面の雰囲気が変わることがないので、人によっては序盤で飽きてしまうかもしれない。ただ、価格も安いので暇つぶし程度にプレイするには良いゲームだと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198119808516', 'num_games_owned': 1854, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1513338813}
review:
有名な騙し絵をもとに作られたミニマルパズル

特徴は紹介の画像まんまで、奥行きの錯覚を利用した現実にはありえない構造の上を進んでゴールを目指します
人間の脳はともすると実際の形状にあてはめて考えてしまうので、簡単に見える形状でもなかなか難しかったりします
ゲーム中同じところをグルグル回っているように見えても、メビウスの輪のようにいつの間にか反対側にいたりして混乱します
結局ゴールまでの道筋を考えながら解くことになるので、将棋等のボードゲームで手順を考えるのと同じ感覚を味わえます
適当に動かして解くこともできますが、パズルゲーでは本末転倒なので考えましょう

パズルは良いとして音楽やグラフィックが単調なのが残念
一気にやろうとすると飽きるので、他に音楽を流してたまにやると良い暇つぶしになります

author: {'steamid': '76561198072377049', 'num_games_owned': 1299, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1511992117}
review:
I played another game based in M.C. Escher, the game was The Bridge, it was ok but doesn't take full advantage of the impossible objects, this one does and the key mechanic is moving between planes in the object to reach the destination. I Don't know If most of the levels are created by the developer or based on Draws that should be public domain right now, in either case, the levels look amazing and the Cuboids are outstanding. 

The only bad thing is the lack of new GUI for this PC port, but to be fair the game is really cheap and often in 50% discount, so I don't mind this too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970509330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1516066072}
review: Based on MC Escher style puzzles, the game revolves around you trying to get a red cube into its proper slot on the puzzle "surface". Things are not as they seem, so the impossible becomes possible. A great little puzzle game that includes the ability to create your own mindbenders and share them. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198446144590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1512161713}
review:
Возможно вам нравится невозможное искусство? Или как его называют «имп-арт»? Решайте и создавайте свои головоломки в игре Hocus в этом стиле.
Больше всего понравился как устроен редактор Hocus. Головоломка набирается на поле из шестигранников в три шага. Результат сохраняется в виде карточки, в формате jpg. К сожалению, редактор не поддерживает геймпад в отличие от режима прохождения головоломки.

Больше обзоров: [url=steamcommunity.com/groups/alteracia] Группа	[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197993104943', 'num_games_owned': 1034, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1511746414}
review:
100 levels of mind-bending M.C. Escher-Style Puzzles to navigate. Some look crazy hard but turn out to be forehead-smackingly simple, others look super easy but will have you simultaneously laughing and growling in amused frustration at the workings of your own confused brain. If you've got a weakness for optical illusions, this game is for you! And if you've ever wanted to create something of your own that would melt other people's gray matter, check it out, there's a level builder!

9/10, would watch my brain go to mush again!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198051461539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1639740765}
review:
Catagories	Ranking	Summery
Value	$20	Well worth the money if you're one who loves the old school arcade classics
Gameplay	8 stars	very old school, even when you have it on easy it can still catch you off guard which is great
Story	5 stars	theres not much of a story but it doesnt really need one
Social System	2 stars	There isnt much of a social system in the game its the sort you get and play with your buddies
Community	N/A	See above
Graphics	7 stars	its a vast improvement from the old NES game or even the old N64 version
Ease of Learning	10 stars	face the right direction and click.. not that hard
Combat Style	6 stars	its all agility and button mashing but who cares its still fun
Soundtrack	9 stars	music isnt bad but the part that does it for me is the snide little remarks when you destroy the food and kill the enemies that amuses the hell out of me

author: {'steamid': '76561198413880168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1506331182}
review:
Completado TODOS los 100 niveles, TODOS los logros desbloqueados.

Bonito y minimalista juego de puzzles en 3D basado en dibujos de perspectiva imposible (como el triángulo de Penrose). El objetivo es desplazar la pieza roja por el cuerpo de la estructura hasta alcanzar la meta, objetivo nada fácil pues nuestro mundo tridimensional no puede concebir estas fantásticas estructuras que desafían la realidad física. Juego muy sólido y completo que además incluye un modo creación para dibujar, crear, compartir y jugar en pantallas totalmente diseñadas por jugadores. BRAVO

Gráficos y Tecnología >>> BIEN + 1,5 puntos

Reservando todo color para la pieza roja que movemos y la meta, el resto del juego es en una elegante escala de grises con fondo blanco, botones y menús en negro y todo muy intuitivo y esquemático. El diseño 3D tipo 6G de las piezas imposibles es muy nítido y  en todo el juego sólo he encontrado un error de solapamiento gráfico en un nivel (y sólo se daba cuando movíamos el cubo por ese punto). La visualización de partidas creadas por otros jugadores también es muy buena (seeds). Además es de los juegos Steam que menos rendimiento y peso reclaman (SÓLO 51mb). Puede funcionar en pantalla completa o ventana.

Historia y Niveles >>> POBRE + 0,5 puntos

No hay historia, sólo 100 niveles que se desbloquean de forma consecutiva. Los primeros de ellos son un tutorial que se agradece y permite ganar soltura al juego, fácilmente alcanzas el nivel 25 (primer logro). Luego el juego se complica y los niveles más complejos requieren bastante tiempo, una peculiaridad del juego es que más que enfocarlo como un puzzle se resuelve con mayor eficacia si lo concibes como un maze-game, dibujando mentalmente la forma de salir de cada nivel. No obstante los niveles más difíciles con diferencia están entre el 60 y el 80, por alguna extraña razón los niveles 80 al 100 son solo moderados.

Música y Sonidos >>> OK + 1 puntos

La banda sonora es muy simple y algo dramática en su tonalidad (como de juego de misterios o creepypasta), aunque combina aceptablemente con el estilo minimalista del juego. No me gustó para el título pero es correcta. En mi caso la desconecté y me quedé jugando con los sonidos y mi propia música (aún con la pantalla completa, el juego no detiene VLC player o youtube). Los sonidos también son correctos y acordes a la música, con efectos suaves que no desentonan y acompañan los movimientos del cubo rojo con elegancia.

Control y Jugabilidad >>> BIEN + 1,5 puntos

Se puede jugar con el ratón perfectamente; no entiendo la recomendación del juego de utilizar mando por que en ningún momento se hace necesario. Para más ironía, mis mandos de PC no funcionan con él pero asumo que el Steam Controller si. En cualquier caso, el uso del ratón permite disfrutar y completar el juego que tiene una jugabilidad muy sólida, sin bugs de rendimiento ni niveles imposibles. Con el tiempo de juego, he notado que los niveles más difíciles normalmente son los que tienen mapas más grandes. ¿por qué en el nivel 100 no hicieron un súpernivel verdaderamente complicado? Me faltó eso.

Integración en Steam >>>  BIEN + 1,5 puntos

El juego tiene cuatro logros con los que no se han complicado demasiado, aunque cumplen y los dos últimos llevan varias horas de concentración para acabar con todos los niveles. Pienso que habría que crear logros que potenciaran el uso de mapas creados por otros jugadores, pero está bien. El juego también tiene cromos, no muy logrados, pero no tiene marcadores de Steam (no sabría como meterlos en ese juego todo sea dicho). Eso si: Su precio es muy bueno, 1 euro por un juego que ofrece horas de desafío moebius que además, en ocasiones, está rebajado con las ofertas Steam. Recomendadísimo por ese precio.

Extras, Personalizaciones y DLC  >>> EXTRA + 0,5 puntos

El modo de creación de niveles y la extrema sencillez con la que pueden ser compartidos por los jugadores (a través de cartas o códigos) bien valen un reconocimiento. Beneficia en mucho la rejugabilidad del juego. Además, el juego ha incrementado en el pasado su número de niveles, y es posible que lo haga en el futuro.

CONCLUSIÓN FINAL >>>  6,5 un BUEN juego, recomendado !

Hocus se ha esforzado para no ser uno más de los cientos de puzzles a un euro que poblan Steam, he jugado muchos de ellos y puedo decir que este juego ha encontrado un concepto original y único que le da personalidad. Como juego de puzzles, tiene ese punto relajante que favorece la concentración, una cadena larga de niveles a superar y un entorno sólido y visualmente atractivo pero añade además una rejugabilidad sin precedentes con un editor de niveles que sorprende por su sencillez de uso y disfrute. Muy recomendado para cualquier biblioteca Steam, sobretodo a amantes de laberintos, puzzles e ilusiones ópticas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995708004', 'num_games_owned': 1761, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1500308240}
review:
エッシャーのだまし絵的な迷路ゲーム。道が分岐しだすと、なかなか頭がこんがらがって難しい。
適当に動かしていたら気がついたら解けていた、ということも多いが、それではつまらない。
このゲームを本気で楽しもうと思うと、適当に動かすより、頭を使って道を探したほうがよい。スタートからはこの順路があって・・・ゴールからはこの順路しかないから・・・あ！繋がった！そんな、迷路を解くことに快感を覚えるなら買い。
適当な遊び方すると30ステージぐらいで飽きる。

author: {'steamid': '76561197996550048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1505119512}
review: hocus is a game of mind-bending 3D mazes. You roll a red cube around impossible objects to get to a red goal. Over time, you'll learn how to map out routes to the goals in your head, but personally I found it fun to just roll the cube around randomly and see where it takes me — sometimes I would even get to the goal earlier than expected by doing that. With plenty of content at 100 levels plus a level editor, this is overall a good, relaxing puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138982847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1513798977}
review:
Their is a lot of worth to this puzzle game.
It was fun as a time waster and overall good quailty for the price.
Hocus also has Steam Trading Cards with up 10 cents a card.
The cards also have a role with making your own levels and content.
The edited level will also display your steam name.
Hocus for Pc will also create a Jpg or image of your level and this can be placed into the community.
The only way to make this better would be more levels from the Hocus team but the 100 serve's a 5 hour quzzle fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354264816', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1502892888}
review:
音效：8分，画面：7分，难度：7.5分，平均分7.5分
类似纪念碑谷，游戏包装比纪念碑谷更纯粹，适合空间想象力足够的人群作为休闲游戏，70/100的关卡都是凭感觉过的，没有什么很强的挑战性。觉得如果给高中生当作空间想象力训练游戏应该还不错.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138558085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1502828803}
review:
From the same dev as VOI, with a very similar aesthetic. This time it's Escher impossible construction puzzle levels. Basically get the red cube to the red marker navigating the impossible architecture to change your plane. 

There's a 100 levels, the first 50 levels are from the developer, and the second 50 are a curated set from user created levels (made in the functional but esoteric map creator). The levels themselves can initially seem mind melting but ultimately can be solved via trial and error path choice or just working backwards from the goal. 

It's good but I think overall I preferred VOI.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112452826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1505684587}
review: Really good value for money. A great little puzzle game, and a lot more difficult than one would think. I've had a lot of fun playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131238455', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1513015286}
review:
Hocus to gra dla ludzi którzy mają mocną głowę. Dosłownie. Gra wykorzystuje zasady logiczne o których naszemu mózgowi się nie śniło (fizjologom). Ciekawy pomysł ale nie ma tam żadnego wyniesienia tej rozgrywki na wyższy poziom, poprostu po  30 poziomach gra staje się monotonna i gra wskakuje na pozycję "zapychacza" w czasie oczekiwania na aktualizacja bądź znajomych. Jeśli lubicie łamigłówki, to ta gra jest dla was. Jeśli nie lubicie myślenia i frustrujecie się szybko to odradzam bo to strata czasu i pieniędzy. 

Polecam wielkim mózgom!

ocena: 7,6/10

review:
Oh wow... what a mindf**k!!! I had to replay Level 25 several times just to work out how on earth I managed to solve it!

This game is epic and is MORE than worth the Steam Sale price of 39 PENCE! Even at the full price of 79 PENCE, this game is still amazing value for money.

Pick this up if you like Escher diagrams or Monument Valley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081092991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1497358316}
review:
Головоломка с оптическими иллюзиями, загони красный кубик в лузу, катая его по граням геометрических предметов, обман зрения гранями фигур,  довольно интересно, несложно при наличии развитого пространственного зрения, главное идти от противного и вовремя сменить грань, в принципе если идти от лузы можно довольно легко найти маршрут, 100 уровней, 4 ачивки за каждые 25 уровней, годная игра с расслабляющей музыкой
Отдельно хочу отметить красный кубик в серебристом лабиринте, очень стильно смотрится

author: {'steamid': '76561198349488567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1500093970}
review:
一个月前购买这个游戏，现在终于通关了。。不是因为[spoiler] 智商不够	[/spoiler]。因为。。这游戏每天不能玩超过10关，否则世界观容易崩！！！
不开玩笑了。虽然色调单一，但游戏是好游戏，很考验空间几何想象力以及脑补绘图水平，但是一次游戏玩的久了真的会晕。
通关时间2-5小时，就像走迷宫一样从终点出发逆向往回走能简单一些，摸清套路之后也没那么复杂。
准备推荐给即将高考的表弟，当作考前押题了，然后我估计他数学能打满分吧。。/滑稽
另：为什么开发商不在界面全语言打勾呢，参照隔壁某些厂商。。。。
