author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1643039944}
review:
Tags: Casual - Sokoban
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Back to Bed is similar but nicer overall. Simplistic and interesting design choices that draw the eye on the shapes and their odd forms. Better played on mobile.

Xbox 360 pad detected correctly. Game fullscreened correctly on my system. Clean presentation. Liked the little metal clicky sound the cube makes while it moves. Zen meditation chimes are a good idea. 100 optical illusion / logical impossibility shapes that must be navigated from a start to an end point. 

They have thrown in a level editor. No steam workshop integration which is too bad. Even at full price its effective and interesting, does not frustrate, and is a great introduction to the illogical shape concept.

On the other hand, the title is also available on mobile and phones where its unity engine, and bland lack of assets belong quite a bit more. While I am a huge fan of the concept that is on display here, and the interactivity with shapes in the mild of small linear sokoban action helps draw your eye to the shapes and angles, it still somehow does not nearly do enough to compete with something with a real art style and an attempt at actual gameplay mechanics

https://store.steampowered.com/app/308040/Back_to_Bed/

author: {'steamid': '76561198084350420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1509227883}
review:
[h1]Kleines Rätselspiel für entspanntes Knobeln zwischendurch [/h1]
Ein super Rätselspiel, die Optischen Ilusionen machen das Lösen der einzelnen Rätsel zu einer echten Denkaufgabe, die selbst wenn man den Pfad des kleinen roten Würfels gedanklich nachzeichnet nicht unbedingt leichter wird. Meist sind es die direckten Wege die einem nicht sofort ins Auge springen, man versucht sich und versucht sich und doch ist es dann der leichteste weg der, ohne das man die seite hätte wechseln müssen, einen zum Ziel führt. [spoiler] Level 50 ;) [/spoiler]
Die 0,99€ sind gut angelegtes Geld für ein Spiel das einem Stundenlangen Knobelspaß und einiges an Kopfzerbrechen bereitet.
[b]Top eine Absolute kaufempfehlung für alle Rätselfans![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198164382571', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1493309958}
review:
A l'instar de [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/204240][i][b]The Bridge[/b][/i][/url], la variété des mécaniques en moins, [i][b]Hocus[/b][/i] est un puzzle-game basé sur l'oeuvre d'[i]Escher[/i], autrement dit reposant sur l'emploi de perspectives impossibles et donc trompeuses. En clair, gardez-vous d'accorder trop de crédit à ce que vous racontent vos yeux, sans quoi vous risquez de ne jamais atteindre la sortie. Un contenu décent - 100 niveaux - au gré duquel s'installe cependant une certaine monotonie, faute de mécaniques supplémentaires. D'un autre côté, son prix reste très abordable.

[h1]Verdict : 3/5 - Ce qui est assez bien, mais pas top.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198289811724', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1674147986}
review:
Ah, comment ne pas parler de ce jeu ! 
Un véritable casse tête qui repose sur les objets 3D impossible (ce fameux triangle)
Vous êtes en face du problème, mais vous devez retourner trois fois votre cerveau avant même d'avoir l'infime espoir d'avoir trouvé. Super sympa entre ami. L'ergonomie à la manette est complète.
C'est un jeu à possèder ! 
Il y a des MAJ de temps en temps rajoutant des niveaux
Pour son prix, c'est un cadeau.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086996820', 'num_games_owned': 2107, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1495187907}
review:
=====20170519追記=====
全100ステージクリアしました。
Cleard all 100 stages.
3D迷路として手軽に遊べて良いと思う。
難易度は予想通り、後半特に難しくなることは無かった。
enough good as a 3D maze.
As expected the difficulty level was never particularly difficult in the second half.
=======ここまで=======

100ステージ中50ステージまでクリアしたので現時点の感想を
Now I cleared stage 50 of 100.So write down my thoughts.
各ステージは難易度よりもデザインに焦点が当てられているのか、徐々に難易度が上がっているわけではないと思う。でももしかしたら残りのステージはもっと難しいかもしれない。
Each stage seems to be focused on design rather than difficulty, so I do not think gradually the degree of difficulty is rising. However, perhaps the remaining stages may be more difficult.

だまし絵迷路、だまし絵好きならプレイ推奨
Trompe l'oeil maze. Recommend if you like that genre. 

難易度difficulty：
★★★★☆（自分縛りでスタートからゴールまで事前にルートを考えるとかなり頭を使う）
(If you think route from the start point to the goal,you have to think a lot.)
★★☆☆☆（クリアするだけなら適当にやったり総当たりしていけば解ける）
(For just clear stage,You can solve if you move by brute force)

ボリュームvolume：
★★★★☆（100ステージ）
(Total 100 stages.)


ちなみにコントローラー(アナログスティック)推奨と書いてあるのですが、手元のSteamControllerは対応していないみたいでした。※設定次第かも

Recommended to use controller with analog stick,
but my steamcontroller couldn't use for this.

追記(20170414)：
言語依存0なので英語が出来なくても問題ありません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198179011207', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1491823270}
review:
В целом, игра неплохая. Отличная задумка.. Интерфейс очень приятный, радует глаза.. Спокойный саундтрек.. 
Но все это быстро надоедает.. Абсолютно однотипные уровни с постоянно повторяющимися фигурами.. 
Больше 10 уровней подряд играть вообще не хочется. 
Если же несколько уровней за один сеанс, то игра стоит внимания и траты денег

author: {'steamid': '76561198216537667', 'num_games_owned': 1998, 'num_reviews': 305, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1499415494}
review:
[b][u]Overall Rating:[/u][/b] 8.5/10  
Not a "must have", but a dern fun little [b]casual[/b] puzzle game, to kill time with, and keep your brain working. A bit. Worth full price (it's an inexpensive game), definitely worth it on sale.

[list]{*]Escher-esque puzzles. put into 2.5D. [*]100 levels [*]Level editor to create your own puzzles, and the ability to lay levels created by others (I haven't tried either yet, tbh, but I plan to, once I beat the vanilla game.) [*] Achievements (only 4, and not as easy to get as one might think) [*]Trading Cards- not terribly valuable for sale, but in a decent rangefor trading or for quick sales.
[*]Puzzles vary in complexity. To be honest, the order they are in seems a bit random, from simple to complex, back to simple. (But considering this was a mobile game meant for phones and tablets, before it came to PC, I can see why a "break" was put in at places. The thought of all of the smashed-in-rage iPhones and iPads that not giving a break would create... :O )
[*]Not too easy, but not too hard. (I am currently at 3 hours of playtime, as of this review being posted, and am stopped at Lvl 42 for a break... not being a superstar puzzle gamer, but not being a total derp either...).
[*]Pleasant music, not too intrusive, and IMHO quite relaxing, allowing you to concentrate on the puzzle, while possibly relaxing you too much to pay full attention. Well played.  *wink*[/list]

I can see ths as being a popular mobile distraction, something that won't disturb others around you, as you play during travels, sit in a waiting room, orrelax in a lobby. For PC, it is a nice break from games that require a ton fof clicking and more active ones that can stress you out. Nice distraction for me from doing programming work from the home office, when I need to silence the inner code-string voices. Not so distracting that I forget about everything, else- it is not a "full immersion" type of game. But distracting and relaxing enough to let me rest my thoughts a bit and gather them together again. 

Nice little puzzler. Recommended for puzzle game enthusiasts, who are not prone to fits of rage. You will backtrack. You will restart a few levels. But you will probably enjoy the process. Just my take on it. Your Mileage May Vary. Widely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092550843', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1478713496}
review:
«hocus» — отличное развлечение для любителей головоломок. С детства нам ставят задачу разгадать ту или иную головоломку. «hocus» поставит вам не менее 100 таких задач. И каждая будет гораздо сложнее другой. Разгадывая эти головоломки вам придется напрячь не только зрение, но и извилины головного мозга. 
Всю игру сопровождает приятная успокаивающая музыка, которая настраивает вас на нужный лад и помогает сконцентрироваться. Ваша задача довести красный куб до пункта назначения. Сама головоломка представляет собой сложные иллюзорные фигуры. От уровня к уровню иллюзия становится все сложнее, а лабиринт запутаннее. Первые пару уровней являются обучающими. Но уже они вовлекают вас в игру. Вы не заметите, как окажетесь на 30 уровне.
Конечно на пути к решению, вы не раз столкнетесь со сложностями. Но игра не даст вам потеряться и предложит вам подсказки. Она покажет направления в которых стоит двигаться, что бы достичь цели. Подсказки являются абсолютно бесплатными, их количество не ограничено. Но я сомневаюсь, что кто-то захочет ими пользоваться без особой нужды. Разгадывая эти запутанные лабиринты, вы получите несколько часов интеллектуального удовольствия.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137853228', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1491130024}
review:
I purchased the game on discount because it was pretty cheap and I like puzzles and optical illusions, so why not?

Anyway, this could've been a really cool game but unfortunately it isn't. For a puzzle game it simply doesn't provide a mental challenge. There's no "AHA!" moment when the solution clicks, you can complete each level just by wandering around with the cube until you just finish it, which isn't satisfactory at all. I was pretty bored for the half-hour I played it, which amounted to about 1 level per minute.

I'll probably tackle the remaining levels later for the achievements and the cards, which are the only reasons I have to continue playing hocus. I wish being entertained was another reason, but alas it is not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979782361', 'num_games_owned': 935, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1632566648}
review:
hocus is a good, short puzzle game that is based around impossible 3D shapes depicted in 2D, reminiscent of M. C. Escher's style. There are 100 standard puzzles and there is also a Workshop for fan-made content. There is also an editor that is very easy to use for you to make your own puzzles. The art style is minimalistic and the music calm and peaceful. The goal is to direct a small cube from a starting point to a hole on a different place on the shape. You'll need to use the odd nature of the impossible shapes (an "impossible angle" as it were) to get the cube from one side to another. Picked it up for $0.49 and I felt it was worth it for that price. I believe you can play this on a smartphone too, so I guess if you need a short, quick brain-teaser to pass the time, this will be enjoyable. Well-optimized and smart, this game doesn't hold your hand, give you any hints, or give you an easy time. 

One drawback is that while the sound they chose for the cube as it travels along a path makes sense and is good in theory, it can get annoying after a while. Thankfully you can turn off sound effects (and music, too). Also, it's a bit inconsistent in terms of difficulty. Once you get to about the level 20s, it bounces around between solutions that are easy to find and others that are quite difficult and require a lot of trial and error. Another reviewer said that his problem with the game is that you can usually brute force your way through the game and, well, that's kind of true up to a point. Another thing is that there aren't many levels that are memorable. However, I did like the concept, art and sound design, the customization options, and the skill increase among the first twenty or so puzzles. I beat the game (100 puzzles) in 3.8 hours, which leads me to say it took me an average of 2.28 minutes per puzzle, if that's any indication of the amount of time you'd like to spend per puzzle.

Ultimately I thought this was a good puzzle game that's very simple to understand and makes you think without bogging you down with text, intros, tutorials or plot. Especially recommended if you enjoy the art style of M. C. Escher.  Worth it if it's on sale in my opinion.

review: I would reccomend this game. It's great for whenever I'm bored and need something to do. The puzzles are fun and challenging and it's great for any optical illusion fan. It also has a level editor which is a lot easier to use than a lot of other game level editors. It deserves a lot more credit than it gets, especially at only 99 cents. And even though I LOVE the levels, the part at the beginning where you can play with the controller is seriously the most entertaining thing ever. I would definitely reccomend hocus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158739744', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1488420995}
review:
´_>` 游戏内按“ESC”键可进入窗口模式，

看到这款小游戏的名字的第一反应，是那个“《福尔摩斯》与‘胡建’翻译 ”的小段子。

小体量独立游戏，以潘洛斯三角为基本构型组建迷宫的谜题游戏，需要一点空间想象能力、记忆力以及耐心。

缺点挺多，BGM单调，配色坏眼睛，关卡排布非常随意没有任何内容变化或难度递进，数量又太多，即使抱着“好啊好啊！错觉谜题我最喜欢了！”的心态开始游玩，到中后期的时候还是有些生无可恋了。操控上不知道使用手柄会不会好一些，鼠标戳起来是有点伤感的。

打折期才两块钱还算物有所值。

不过让我意外的是，这款游戏内置了关卡编辑器。可以设计自己的谜题来游玩，甚至能够通过生成“Card”或者密码将关卡分享出去。然而，并没有创意工坊。

author: {'steamid': '76561198183087631', 'num_games_owned': 1454, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1560875907}
review:
Daha önce telefondan oynama imkanı bulduğum Monument Valley oyununa benzeyen bu oyunda da algılarımızı test edilmekte :) 3 boyutlu görmeyi, düşündürmeyi, bakmak ve görmek arasındaki farkı bize yaşatan bu güzel oyunu kesinlikle tavsiye ediyorum :) 2 TL gibi bir fiyata hem güzel bir oyun elde ediyorsunuz , hem de Geometrinizi bir tık ileri taşıyorsunuz :)

İnceleme yazarken farkettiğim bir diğer ayrıntı da yapımcısının Türk olması. Türk yapımcılardan bu denli güzel, yaratıcı oyunlar çıkıyor olması sevindirici.Piyasadaki diğer Türk oyunlarının hali ortada nede olsa.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983082568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1485036832}
review:
[b]hocus[/b] on PC / Steam  
Score 9.5 / 10

I need games like [b]hocus[/b]: Short levels, interesting concepts to manipulate in my mind (3D flattened in 2D), some advantage to trial and error that leads to learning, easy to pick up and easy to put down. Moving a cube around in an Escher-like minimal design esthetics, [b]hocus[/b] delivers the goods exactly to my taste, and the music is soothing to boot.

Allow me to clarify certain points brought up in negative reviews:
1. Congratulations to the devs for making a game that when ported from phone to the pc retains every bit of the simplicity enjoyment and charm of the original. 
2. If you need to ‘brute force’ every puzzle then you are not taking time to smell the flowers. Many of the puzzles are reducible to a small set of solutions; pause and think about each one before you start because the pleasure is in the thinking.
3. This game plays in full screen if you wish.
4. Inexpensive is sometimes a gift. Accept this gift.

Last positive points
A puzzle creator / level editor is included and is quite intuitive; you can upload your level as a .jpg file to share with friends. Here is one that I made for you; download it to your hard drive and upload it into the game....

http://i.imgur.com/JsaChOj.jpg

Steam accoutrements
4 Achievements (4.5 hrs 100%) and 8 Cards. No cloud ! (sniff)

Game score 9.5 / 10 
10 / exemplary execution of the genre with compelling innovation
[u]9 / exemplary execution of the genre don’t miss out, for fans of the genre and the curious alike[/u]
8 / for well done not a must play, fans of the genre and newbs will be happy it is well done 
7 / for calibrated expectations only, fans of the genre would not miss out if they skipped this
6 / only for serious fans of the genre for whom game play with bugs is acceptable
5 / enough bugs to make me unhappy

author: {'steamid': '76561198047160136', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1484846481}
review:
[quote=我在Steam上学数学] 
永不下降的阶梯

潘洛斯三角形

拓扑学	[/quote]

利用视觉错误制作小游戏，画风清爽明亮。总计一百关，游戏模式重复性较高，但小方块滚动很魔性。有像当时玩Lyne一样的谜之快感。


Tips：1. 利用终点倒退且能记住10次转折以上会使难度下降不少。
          2. 手柄游戏轻松写意

预计用时6小时，实际用时3小时完成全成就通关。





以下是神叨叨。
[i]  前50关花了2小时，后50关花了一小时，很明显感觉到通过前50关对转折路线形成了模式记忆，后50关大多数情况下凭直觉就能直接走出。假想是大脑分析视觉信息形成神经活动的速度要快于意识产生，说明意识是大脑神经活动经过转译加工后的产物。 
[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198062301817', 'num_games_owned': 878, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1484947241}
review:
The trailer really got me: I thought this was a very clever mind-bending game. Now, that might just be me, but I don't feel like I'm solving puzzles at all when playing hocus. I mindlessly move the red cube around until there's a clear path to the goal. Well, that's not entirely true: if I see that one path leads to a dead-end, I obviously don't take it. You'd be surprised by how often that happens. Also, if a path gets me back to somewhere I already went without success, then I won't take it either.

In other words, I brute-force every solutions (at least I think so). I could try to figure out how to get to the end right away, but that would probably take the same time as trying anything until it works. It's sad really, and it doesn't make achieving a level very rewarding. I always get tired after 4 levels or so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144943577', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1483580322}
review:
[h1] ルービックキューブみたいな物を転がし迷路のようなゴールを目指せ [/h1]

行ける場所ならクリックすれば行ってくれるので中盤まで位は適当でもなんとかなる

[h1] ゲーム内容 [/h1]

赤くはめ込めそうなゴールにはめ込めばゴールで、クリックすると行ける場所にはその場所まで行ってくれるので、適当に押しておけばクリアもできるが中盤以降は複雑で適当でもクリアできなくないがきついかもしれない、頭で考えても頭痛くなるし結局少し考えて後は行き当たりばったりで何とかなるかもしれないゲームです。

[h1] 個人的に思った事や感想 [/h1]

適度に少しずつやるのがベストなゲームだと思う、好きな人は一気にやってしまってもいいと思うが、FPSなどで疲れた後少しやって寝るみたいなゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198126627796', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1488746341}
review:
[b]Ow my head![/b]

Hocus is a masterpiece! I couldnt play a game more addicting than this. If your tired or bord, go play hocus :P Its on mobile too so you can take it on the go! Just to add, once you finish the game, and that alone is fun and hard, you can make your own levels and share levels with others! I have never seen such a mind puzzling game

The only issues I have and this only applies to the steam version of the game are the bugs. Sometimes it will just stop your cube randomly but you get used to it and it will fix in a second. Also the borders and resolution could be managed but its a simple fix. You most likely can adjust the resolution in your launch options on steam.

If I were you I would get this game. For 99 cents (US) It is perfect fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198287970876', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1483043324}
review:
Myślisz... Myślisz... Myślisz... Wreszcie! Masz plan jak dojść do czerwonego punktu! Już ucieszony toczysz się po ścianach, ale chwila... Twój plan zakładał że z lewej ściany przejdziesz na prawą część podstawy, a okazało się że ta prawa podstawa to w rzeczywistości lewa część prawego sufitu, przyczepionego do odwróconej prawej ściany, która jest na lewo od podłogi, która połączona jest z sufitem, który okazuje się być jedynie połączeniem między lewą ścianą, a lewym syfitem...
Tak... To w skrócie co czeka Cię w hocus'ie. Gra genialna w swej... krzywości...

author: {'steamid': '76561197971341065', 'num_games_owned': 3377, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1627173877}
review:
Really nice puzzle game based on following the sides of an object that is an optical illusion/impossible shape, either following the side of the object around, or also if you are in the inside of a 90 degree turn (or what looks like one if you pay no attention to the rest of the shape). This allows to traverse all over the object generally, although getting to the target location is often the hardest place to navigate to on the shape.

There are plenty of levels to go through, given there are no new mechnics added, just the shapes slowly get more complicated to traverse. But still it is very well implemented and fun to play, and very mind bending. I personally found it easier to play on controller than mouse or keyboard, but it isn't too bad whichever way you go.

Overall it is an easy recommend for a cheap self contained puzzle game to spend an evening on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075780802', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1481494947}
review:
Impossible tribars, squares, pentagons and hexagons. Puzzles. More is not relevant to being more difficult to solve, simple can be more challenging and also perfect. Complicated perspectives are there to position, before placing them in a solution in order to make sense. If this doesn't make sense, it's supposed to not make sense. In a good way of course. That's how I felt while solving hocus' puzzles.

The game starts off easy and as the levels increase they, the puzzles, become a lot more challenging. You won't be playing against a clock, so loosen up, observe, think and move... or waste your time just moving the cube aimlessly until you find the solution. The latter will in most cases take you longer. Nevertheless, logic is not really the answer everywhere, like Escher's stairs or this riddle: if my mother's your mother's mother-in-law, what would the kinship be?

author: {'steamid': '76561198142781411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1533269553}
review:
Con alrededor de 2 horas, (ya que en pocas ocaciones lo juego), les expongo mi evaluacion:

[h1]PROS[/h1]
[olist]
 [*] 100 niveles 
 [*] Es un reto (al principio)
 [*] Los rompecabezas son 'solucionables'. Siempre  habra una via para resolverlos aunque no lo este a simple vista
[/olist]

[h1]CONTRAS[/h1]
[olist]
[*] Repetitivo tanto la musica como los rompecabezas
[*] Estresa el sonifo FX que tiene puesto el cubo a la hora de avanzar por los rompecabezas (por suerte se puede desactivar)
[*] No hay variedad en los escenarios, un fondo blanco y YA!
[*] Salvo que estes ocioso, es entretenido, por que de estar estresado, creeme que este juego te va a causar [b]mas estres[/b] xD
[/olist]

Precio modico y si lo hallas en oferta, pffff... hasta te sobra para otro juego.
[b]Veredicto: 3/5[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198042792724', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1510627965}
review:
Certainly a recommended game—I think hocus provides a very innovative take on the traditional puzzle game, playing with your perception of the environment to offer a challenge that looks simple at first but quickly shows to be a complicated thing to surmount. I'm a fan of casual games that offer a break from their strategy-intensive or action-packed counterparts, and this game is definitely near the top of my list for casual gaming.

Truly an example of a game that is good not because of overwhelming content, but because of the skillful application of simple mechanics combined with a novel idea. Again, recommended to all, especially players of puzzle games.

全成就撒花~
视觉错位游戏，基本都是利用潘洛斯三角形的原理。所以玩久了可能会比较单一、厌倦。

author: {'steamid': '76561198020031060', 'num_games_owned': 1008, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1479652176}
review:
エッシャー的なねじれた空間で、赤いキューブをゴールまで運ぶパズル、というか迷路ゲーム
のんびりリラックスしたいけど、手持ち無沙汰は落ち着かないって人におすすめ

もともとスマホ向けのゲームらしくPCでプレイする上では少々不便なところがあるが、プレイに支障が出るたぐいのものではない。
数分でクリアできる小さなステージが大量に用意されていて、PCモニタの前で腰を据えてプレイするよりは、やはり空き時間にスマホでちょこちょこやるようなゲームだと思う。難易度はステージによりけりで、あとの方のステージだから特別難しいということはない。
本質的には迷路ゲーなので、構造物と分岐が増えて、視覚的に見づらくなることが難易度の増加につながるが、このhocusはゲーム性よりも構造物の形の面白さや雰囲気を味わえるように作られている。

エディターでステージを自作することも可能で、その自作ステージをカードやコードにして他者と共有できるシステムがあるようだが、機能してるのかいまいちわからなかった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198119861960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1549092657}
review:
뫼비우스의 띠 혹은 착시현상을 유발하는 도형 및 구조물에 빨간 박스가 있는데 그걸 빨간 바닥에 도착시키면 깨는 게임..
가면 갈수록 머리를 써야하는게 정석이지만 아무생각없이 무념무상으로 이리저리 돌리면서 깨봄...
디자인도 괜찮고 가격도 정가 1100원 현재 할인가 550원.
이런 가격에 스테이지가 무려 100개나 있으니 솔직히 혜자다.
심심풀이로 하기에 안성맞춤이다.
메인으로 할 게임 구매 뒤 돈이 조금 남았다면 이거 사보는 것도 나쁘지 않을 듯.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1612287587}
review:
[url=https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/M._C._Escher]M. C. Escher[/url] als Spielthema? Da bin ich immer interessiert. Ich habe es nochmal gespielt.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1130616254
[b]Irrgärten - Gameplay[/b]

Es ist ein reines, minimalistisches Rätselspiel mit einer einzigen, aber durchaus interessanten Idee, die wohl auf der [url=https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unm%C3%B6gliche_Lattenkiste]Unmöglichen Lattenkiste[/url] beruht, die auch von dem berühmten Grafiker M. C.Escher verewigt worden ist.

Wir bewegen uns in jedem der 100 Level mit einer kleinen Figur (hier ein roter Würfel) auf den "unmöglichen" dreidimensionalen Gebilden vom Startpunkt zum Zielpunkt.

Die Aufgaben empfand ich als überwiegend einfach. Bei manchen komplexeren Gebilden hat es aber auch etwas länger gedauert. Die Rätsel ähneln einem Irrgarten. Manchmal habe ich das Ziel schnell gefunden, manchmal die richtigen Abzweigungen lange nicht beachtet. Ein Großteil der Wege habe ich aber auch einfach nur ausprobiert.

Insofern erschöpft sich die Spielidee, mehr als die 100 Level baucht es in dieser Situation nicht.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2382348011
[b]Minimalistisch elegant - Technik[/b]

Einen Beenden-Knopf gibt es nicht. Mit Escape kommt man aber in den Fenstermodus und kann so das Spiel beenden.

Die Grafik ist modern minimalistisch schwarz-weiss und gefällt mir sehr gut. Der Sound ist ok, allerdings kann man die Lautstärke im Spiel nicht verändern.

Die Steuerung mit (empfohlenen) Controller ist sehr gut.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2382348245
[b]Sonstiges[/b]

Ich habe für einen Durchgang etwa 4h benötigt (5h beim ersten Mal, 3,5h beim zweiten Mal).

Die Errungenschaften sind einfach, sofern man alle 100 Level löst.

Es gibt auch einen Leveleditor. Den habe ich aber nicht ausprobiert.

[code][b]In Zahlen für mich persönlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 8/10.[/b][/code]

Eine schöne Escher'sche Rätselidee, elegant minimalistisch in Szene gesetzt. Angemessen für den Preis.

[hr][/hr]
[i]Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. Für meine Wertung zählt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abhängig davon, ob ich es einem ähnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198297339279', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1698860984}

review:
Ну что же, игра не плохая. Мне очень понравилась. 
Конечно же не для тех, кому не нравится думать и размышлять логически.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261406855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1483965897}
review:
似乎玩过同一个制作组的另一个游戏，风格也比较像，很简约，设定也不算复杂比较好上手；

操作上除了手柄的*形方向可能一开始不习惯外都还好，特别是在方块运动过程中到达可能转向的节点处会自动停下，否则会一直滚到另一端，不用我们自己找路口或左右调整位置，一定程度上造福了手残和眼癌患者。

虽说利用了视觉悖论，但在每个节点附近（或相邻侧面）的空间逻辑还是挺强的。

目前还没通关，但是目测后面地图会越来越复杂，可能真的要像上下楼某位同学一样截图下来画了。

方法上么，排除死路，倒推路线，玩到后面应该能慢慢看到某些套路了应该就会更快一些了（大概吧）

还有种方法，不要把它当三维看，把它当做平面图形来玩，相连的同一种颜色肯定是可以到达的（这不是废话么233）但是在某些三维悖论处可能会意外的好用。
[spoiler] 其实只要你一直保持移动总有一天会到终点的，相信我。[strike]我在终点等你，明年见[/strike] [/spoiler]

缺点么其他评测也有提到，除了空间悖论没有太多亮点，BGM太空灵233，玩的时间长可能会觉得没劲，不过没事拿出来玩一玩还是挺有意思的，有助于开括思路（？[spoiler] 其实玩到后面思路就变成了套路[/spoiler]）

玩下来感觉像是从移动端移植过来的游戏。

然而让我写这篇评论的唯一原因是：我似乎没有在游戏里找到【退出游戏】对应的游戏选项或手柄按键_(:з」∠)_ 另外竟然没有类似LB/RB切换关卡之类的按键设定，感觉这游戏太简约了（捂脸）

author: {'steamid': '76561198130513127', 'num_games_owned': 1483, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1479460635}
review:
[h1]hocus——视觉错位游戏 [/h1]
[b] 缺乏眼前一亮的感动	[/b]

说到错觉游戏，自然会想到纪念碑谷
而同为极简主义的hocus在各方面表现都略差一些
[list]
    [*]灰白红三色，画面显得单调
    [*]音乐单调，音效略感刺耳
    [*]视角锁定。没有设计通过转视角解谜的部分
    [*]各关卡难度平行，没有进阶；同时整体偏为简单，所有可能路径并不多且自带提示
（你可以使用夏姬八滚大法或者倒推法，都挺靠谱）
[/list]

最近的更新增加了新的关卡、关卡编辑、成就和卡片，然而没有云存档，只得再打一次，游戏整体没有太大变化

总的来说还是过于平庸，没什么亮点
推荐给非常喜爱错觉艺术，想做错觉艺术作品找借鉴（或自己组建模型）的玩家

[spoiler]我觉得“完全支持控制器”那页甩绳子比本体更好玩hhhhh[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198081252523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1479383152}
review:
Словно попал в фильм " Начало "  Кристофера Нолана. В этой игре границ плоскостей просто не существует. Одна плоскость плавно переходит в другую. Эта особенность и ломает мышление игрока. Суть игры в передвижении красного квадратика, которым мы управляем через все плоскости в плоскость "красной посадки" данного квадратика.
Первые 40 уровней прошёл без затруднений, а над остальными пришлось немного попотеть) Слишком замудренных геометричеких фигур в хокусе нет, однако даже с виду самые простые фигуры доставляют приятных хлопот над их решением. 
 Ачивки можно получить соответственно за прохождение определенного количества уровней : 25, 50, 75, 99. Всего в игре 100 уровней.
 Всем советую Hocus  за возможность проявить в себе навыки нестандартного мышления

author: {'steamid': '76561198041108401', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 496, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1478643307}
review:
a[b]MAZE[/b]ing optical illusion puzzle game!
Basically it's just a labyrinth. BUT unlike any other labyrinth, even though you see the whole maze from above, you are NOT able to overlook it and to find the right path! Isn't that crazy? You see everything and still cannot see the exit path? And this is despite the small size of the levels. You cannot even manage to say if you have already been on the path you are right now. This is, because the ways you are moving on can be walked on on 4 sides! Every level impressed me with that the right path to walk is so damn weird, you would never think of it being the right one. That is if you would remember which path you took.
The mazes are still hard if you use the method of starting the first "must-be" path and then try to find the rest from the end back. Most levels are balls of wool in illusionists 3D. 

AWESOME AND UNIQUE MAZE PUZZLE GAME

[code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198021959875', 'num_games_owned': 6844, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1478536683}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198125585399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1499049066}
review: A fun and slighly unconventional puzzle game. Sometimes you can figure a path to the goal, sometimes you can work backwards from it, and other times you wind up there by accident. Such is life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008593454', 'num_games_owned': 1344, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1491403148}
review:
Замечательная игра!

Сложно объяснить, но я получаю удовольствие даже не от решения головоломок, а от разглядывания фигур, перемещения по ним, того, как кубик переходит из одной плоскости в другую.
Несколько десятков уровней я просто смотрел.
Но при этом, после того, как я привык к "искажениям пространства", я смог действительно решать головоломки. Мне не приходилось перемещаться наугад, пытаясь дойти до выхода.

Мне она напоминает [URL=http://store.steampowered.com/app/207570/]English Country Tune[/URL], но принцип головоломок другой.

Конечно, при желании можно найти, к чему придраться. Но на мой взгляд, недочёты незначительны.

Игра выдержана в приятном минималистичном стиле, гладко работает и предоставляет несколько часов необычного развлечения. А те, кому этого мало, могут в дополнение поиграть в пользовательские уровни.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=792842718

author: {'steamid': '76561198091666121', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1477860095}
review: I really enjoy looking or drawing impossible shapes and illusions when I get bored. This game takes those impossible shapes and makes them into fun puzzles by getting a red cube to travel across the "impossible shapes". Sometimes that can make you rage quit at times, but overall hocus is just a chill puzzle game you can relax to. It's also one of the few times a mobile game that was well translated to a PC version.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197993763184', 'num_games_owned': 1220, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1478240767}
review:
Unfortunately, I found this game to be boring.  It felt like one of those mazes that came on your placemat in restaurants as a kid.  You have the choice of tracing from the ending back towards your cube to figure out the route, or just randomly moving around the level hoping to stumble onto the end.  The graphics are great and the mechanics are solid, but it just doesn't provide enough "puzzle" for people like myself.  I thought it would be a mental challenge going into it, but it was not that.

While I hate to click the thumbs down on this one due to its overall quality, delivery, and uniqueness, I have to thumb it down for myself as it is not a real puzzle as I was expecting.  For those just wanting to kill some time and like the concept of Escher's art in a game, you could do a lot worse than Hocus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023609460', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1471378010}
review:
This game has completly made me rethink 3D shapes.
It's a great puzzle game that can be frustrating when things don't go your way (Especially if you're like me and have to plan your route rather than following blind luck) but it's still pretty fun to play.
It's simple design and music fit well and complement the games more complex shapes. It allows me to focus purely on the objective in front of me, which is what a good puzzle game should do.
The level editor is just as simple, just click where you want lines and they appear. You can save your levels as a code or an image to send to your friends, who can then in turn load and play it.
Overall I think this is a great game, especially considering the low price and amount of content and replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079424178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1551883997}

author: {'steamid': '76561198100425969', 'num_games_owned': 2795, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1503852463}
review:
很好的错觉立体感小游戏，游戏目标就是在一个个艾舍尔式的架子上滚动一个正方方块到指定地点。

游戏本身创意、关卡设计和实现都可以打高分了。

只是对这种反直觉的游戏，我的脑子有点承受不了，玩一会就得歇一会。大概是潜意识里的立体感和视觉的冲突比较强烈吧。单调的背景音乐也强化了这种不适感。

游戏还是可以打8分的，要买的依然建议买，反正也便宜而且进过包。如果你没有这种不适感那最好，但不玩之前反正也不知道，不影响你买。

玩的时候最好把自带的背景音乐关了然后开个mp3播放器弄点激昂的音乐听听，能减少不适感。

author: {'steamid': '76561198157313198', 'num_games_owned': 2089, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1479881343}

介个嘛，介款游戏感觉就像是作者展示自己悖论空间图的展览作品~

我只会感觉作者的图形构建能力很强很厉害，然而这个游戏却不能给我带来解谜的乐趣

而且，无卡无成就，只能单纯+1了

author: {'steamid': '76561198080678058', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1467192583}
review: This was quite an amazing game! Very entertaining, and quite difficult! I was able to beat the entire game rather quickly, but the game does promise new leves which I am looking forward to! It requires a completely different way of thinking that quite challenged me, and I was quite satisfied when each level was completed. The music was a bit annoying, but I was able to turn it off, and turn my own music on in the background. The game looks quite nice, and runs well even with many other programs in the background. Overall, I would probably rate this game a 9/10. The gameplay is a 10, how the game runs is a 10, the origniality, and delivery are both 10, and the length is just right for what it is (10/10). However, the music is a 4/10 because it wasn't good at all, but you were able to turn it off, so I don't really have a complaint there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110387447', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1554987523}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1478109354}
review:
https://youtu.be/owVUOexkIb8

Test your eyes and your mind against these M.C. Escher inspired puzzles while navigating a red cube into a red hole.  Ported from a mobile game with swipe controls unfortunately doesn't map smoothly to a controller and cube movement is often fidgety.

While the puzzles are fun to look at they rarely offer any real challenge as the navigation options are so limited at each junction not offer the player much choice.  The slick visuals are just not enough make up for the weak puzzles in this puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035801987', 'num_games_owned': 3543, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1504201142}
review:
Hocus is a puzzle game whose levels are based on M.C. Escher's optical illusion drawings and all incorporate impossible shapes. They are essentialy 2D mazes that give 3D impression. It is a mobile port, you can play it with mouse or gamepad. You will lose sense of direction playing this, getting dizzy is also not out of question. :) Good thing is that you can always look in which directions you can move by checking circle on top of the screen, without it aimlessly wandering around would be common. Minimalist design will let you focus on puzzles with no other distractions. Ambient music is nice, but you will probably turn it off after a while.

Game has 65 levels, they took me about an hour and a half to solve which is ok, game doesn't overstay its welcome with more of the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143034343', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1486349921}

author: {'steamid': '76561198260116642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1477755903}
review:
在玩这个游戏之前，刚玩过《纪念碑谷》……我以为这游戏应该也是差不多的玩法，然而我错了，这只是一个利用视觉错误的滑块小游戏而已。
玩法很简单，就是拖动红色的小方块滚动到目标地点。
然而，每一关都是这样，没有任何新元素。不同的关卡只有路线的不同。游戏过程也很无聊，方块滚动的很慢，完成一关后没有任何满足感。很多次想把它通关，但每次进去玩上一两关就实在玩不下去了。
不过价钱够便宜，打折的时候适合+1。

+极简风画面
+难度不高
+便宜
-单调乏味的游戏过程

author: {'steamid': '76561198090109480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1567084346}
review:
Good mobile game, but not a good PC port.
[list]
[*] a bit laggy
[*] unnecessary pauses (fake "loading" animations) between levels
[*] no reset button
[*] controls could be better (there's no reason why I would want the cube to stop if it's not at a corner or junction)
[/list]

The concept is simple: you roll a cube into a hole over the faces of an impossible-looking structure. It's a kind of maze which you solve by backtracking in your head. It takes a while before you can do it without making mistakes. (Or you can solve the level with trial-and-error, but that's no fun.) None of the levels is hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067891330', 'num_games_owned': 8194, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1478776154}
review:
hocus is a small logic game where you control a cube and roll to a target place. The twist in the gameplay is that the whole level design is based on the [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penrose_triangle]Penrose triangle[/url].

You might get afraid of complex controls in those levels but don't worry, you can use a mouse (click to a place to move to), or a gamepad with analog stick, which I'd recommend. If you ever get lost or you won't know which directions you can move to, there's a circle with arrows on top of the screen that shows you. This can be really helpful at times when you'll be just wandering around the level, unable to find the right path.

The game has totally 65 levels, and all those have low difficulty. You can track the right way before any movement, or just move randomly until you find the right way in few minutes; it's up to you. This game can be a nice relaxing experience if you don't mind the ubiquitous optical illusion. It took me 98 minutes to beat all levels.

Graphic style is minimalistic, which fits the game perfectly. The aural experience of hocus is made of a tranquil song and a sound for the cube's movement. While the game is ported from mobile platform, it's still a polished experience, I haven't found a single gameplay or visual bug through my playthrough.

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
hocus isn't a game that would make people excited, but it's a sleeper in many people's backlogs that deserves a play. It may be short but it offers you enough to enjoy levels designed with M. C. Escher's optical illusion in mind; you'll be done in about hour and half, and I think it's ok for a unique 2€ game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007688772', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 649, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1461951334}
review:
Jednoduchá logická hra, nebo spíš hříčka.
Celá hra spočívá v kutálení červené kostky po povrchu "escherovsky" nereálného 3D objektu do cíle. A to je vše. K dispozici je 65 úrovní s lehce se zvyšující obtížností, ale během nich se už neobjeví žádná nová herní mechanika, takže ty necelé dvě hodiny potřebné k dohrání jsou asi maximální čas, jaký se u podobného hlavolamu dá strávit.
Hra má také jednu velmi netradiční vlastnost - neobsahuje tlačítko na vypnutí a ukončit se dá pouze stiskem ALT+F4.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023555368', 'num_games_owned': 3343, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1558764513}
review:
A short review for a short game.

This isn't a bad game for the price they are asking. I like the simple graphics and how the optical illusion puzzles play with your mind. 

The sound effects are nice but I found myself wishing I could turn off the "music" (more like ambient wind chimes) quickly.

There are a few other quirks such as no steamworks integration and no exit button to the game. You'll have to first switch to window mode or alt+f4 the game to exit it. This is especially funny considering when you open the game they recommend a controller but it is also impossible to close the game with the controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009382494', 'num_games_owned': 1898, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1641664434}
review:
hocus ist genau das, was die Vorschaubilder und -videos bei Steam bereits zeigen. Ein Knobelspiel, das sich auf kreative Art mit optischen Täuschungen beschäftigt. Es handelt sich sich um den PC-Port eines Handyspiels (das es leider nicht für Android-Systeme gibt) und erinnert mich stark an Monument Valley (ebenfalls ein Handyspiel). Im Gegensatz zu Monument Valley handelt es sich bei hocus aber eher um ein Gelegenheitsspiel.


+ Simpel, aber gleichzeitig komplex
+ Sehr einfach zu lernen
+ Wird nach einer gewissen Zeit echt schwer
+ Konzept
+ Ruhig (gut zum Runterkommen)
+ Keine Zwänge (Zeitbegrenzung etc.)
+ Sieht gut aus
+ Insgesamt gelungener Port
+ Sound
-> - Abgesehen vom Bewegungsgeräusch

- Ich hatte schnell keine Lust mehr. Es ist in meinen Augen ausschließlich ein Gelegenheitsspiel
- Steuerung. Sie ist nicht schlimm, aber einfach nur vom Handytippen auf die Maus übertragen worde. WASD hätte mir gefallen
- Keine Optionen
-> - Um in den Fenstermodus zu kommen, muss man Esc drücken


Ein sehr gelungenes Spiel, das ich aber lieber auf meinem Smartphone genießen würde. Bei 49 Cent in einem Angebot kann ich echt nicht klagen und auch die eigentlichen 1,99 sind hierfür nicht zu viel. Schaut mal rein.
Von mir gibt es eine Gesamtwertung von 7,5/10 Punkten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259582289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1461688115}
review:
这小游戏其实最适合pad玩，ios 6块钱，趁着打折2块在steam喜+1也不错，只可惜没卡没成就。
纯点击式操作（也支持滑动），电脑玩也挺好，就是不能躺着来，哈哈哈哈。
一眼就喜欢上了这画风，所以买完就立刻安上通关了，一两个小时就能搞定。
相当于立体迷宫吧，去掉几个教程关卡大概还有60关，难度一般，不耐烦可以乱走试，想锻炼空间想象力可以仔细终点反推。
最重要的是！方块填进洞里的那一瞬间！——强迫症治愈了啊！哈利路亚~~
_(:зゝ∠)_

author: {'steamid': '76561198141316848', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1476998491}
review:
エッシャーの版画のような不可能図形が特徴的なパズルゲーム。
図形の上で立方体を転がすだけだが、道がどこにどう繋がっているのかを考えると非常に混乱し、面白い。
元はスマホゲーらしく、行き先をクリックすると立方体が自動的に転がるのだが、方角さえ合っていれば全然違うところをクリックしてもちゃんと転がってくれる。
細かい操作が必要ないため、転がしたい方向に転がってくれないということが無く快適にプレイできる。
問題は全65問、約90分で解き終えた。
一応soonと続いているので今後アプデで問題が追加される……のか？
※16/10/17追記
アプデで35問追加され、全100問となった。

基本的にゲームそのものは小粒ながら良作。
しかしどうやらスマホからのベタ移植でPC用の最適化は一切していないらしく、UI部分でいくつか問題がある。

まず、問題セレクト画面で[b]マウスホイールと画面スクロールの方向が逆[/b]。
スマホのタッチ操作だと下へスクロールするためには上へドラッグするが、この不具合はそれと関係有るのだろうか……。
ちなみにマウスドラッグで擬似タッチ操作もできる。

さらに[b]メニューに“ゲームの終了”が存在しない[/b]。
試しにESCキーを押したらフルスクリーンが解除されてウィンドウモードになった。（そんな機能あったのか）
どうやらAlt + F4、またはウィンドウ化から閉じるボタンを押すのが正式な終了手順らしい。
なおオプションにフルスクリーンとウィンドウの切り替えが存在しなので、ウィンドウからフルスクリーンにはできない。
（そもそもオプション自体がサウンド関連でちょっとあるだけ）
そして次回起動時は前回終了時の状態にかかわらずフルスクリーンで立ち上がるので、ゲームはウィンドウモードでやりたい人にとっては一手間増える。

author: {'steamid': '76561198083814894', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1460200989}
review:
Really solid game.

Despite it obviously being a mobile port, it really is beautiful. The basic gameplay is the heart of this game. Where something so simple, yet so crafty, can keep playing in frustration. Just to prove to yourself it can be done.

65 levels does seem like a lot for most games. But for Hocus, it is just enough to not get too boring, but plenty enough to provide you with 2 or 3 hours of decent gameplay.

Hocus seems pretty well coded, it supported my ultrawide without hassle (the content however remains central to the screen, with grey background filling in the sides) and it has v-sync enabled.

If it is on sale, I think it is a must buy/must try.
If you're into puzzle games and looking to try something with a little bit of a different twist to it, then yeah, full price is all good.

Just needs some achievements, and trading cards and its a true $5 winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078717084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1477716317}
review:
刚加愿望单就有壕友相送，太爽。
咳咳，为避免+1忘记，所以立马下下来玩一把。
怀着期待已久的心情打开游戏（其实三秒就下完了~），脑海想像着是否是一款PC的《无限回廊》，结果手游解密小清（you）新（xin）的气息扑面而来。
提示竟然还是手指划屏，噗，你这样鬼知道这游戏能用手柄啊（为什么我知道手柄能用？因为我试了）。

好吧，咱说游戏。
游戏暂时有六十多关（包括新手入门关），难度偏简单。
玩法类似纪念碑谷，但是只有其中走格子找路的谜题，但是道路是固定的（上面的圆会带箭头提示你道路可行走的方向）。
对的，你得在越来越复杂的道路里像走莫比斯环带那样，不断地切换方块道路的平面直到找到那个洞的平面。
前面说了游戏很简单基本就像是坐车无聊打发时间的那种手机小游戏，你懂的。
十几分钟过了25关，还有好几分钟是在找有没有调窗口的（然而并没有），你可以花两小时不看攻略彻底通关只要你想。
（倒推法加上一点空间想象力，简直不要太简单）

总结一下
+画面简约清新
+解密娱乐，易上手
+正常+1水准游戏

-内容单一，毫无变化
-手机游戏直接移植到PC上，毫无优化竟然比手机上还贵，以后看到一个喷一次。

author: {'steamid': '76561198167120159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1646091661}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997860863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1515854218}
review:
Un petit jeu à pas cher, partant d'un concept simple mais fort intelligent sur les effets d'optique de la perspective 3D comme on peut le voir dans le jeu "the Bridge" par exemple.
- Graphsmes : épurés qui s'en tiennent au minimum syndical mais c'est un très bon choix poour ce style de jeu, cela lui va comme un gant.
- Musique : zen, rien à dire elle colle à l'ambiance du jeu.
- Maniabilité : manette conseillé au lancement du jeu mais j'y ai joué à la souris sans aucun souci.
- Durée de vie : 65 niveaux (d'autres sont censé arriver par la suite... à voir si c'est effectivement le cas) que j'ai bouclé tranquillement, sans sprinter en 2h30.
- Difficulté : sur ce point j'hésite... j'ai envie de dire trop facile car tombé dans le piège du concept. Je m'explique : le but est de se faire mettre en défaut notre visualisation 3D telle que notre cerveau la conçoit et la perçoit, seulement le concept trouve ici vite ses limites. Je pense que c'est avant tout dû à un level design qui malgré les apparences reste simple quelques soit le niveau (à quelques exceptions près). Je pense aussi que des niveaux plus grands pourront nous perdre plus facilement et j'ai cru comprendre qu'un éditeur de niveaux est en cours de création donc "wait & see"

CONCLUSION : à ce prix je ne peux que le conseiller. Cela retse un soft très sympathique dont les possibilités d'évolution sont intéressantes de mon point de vue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135660261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1505576360}
review: A fun little puzzle game. Its a nice mix of easy, hard and some that you solve by accident!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010356739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1456881119}
review:
Sympa dans le genre casse tête quelque peu prise de tête, le problème c'est je me suis endormi plusieurs fois devant mon écran avant de finalement le terminer. Un effort au niveau du son aurait rendu l'expérience moins banale peut-être.

C'est pas très original comme style de jeu, seul le rappel des figures impossibles de Escher donne à ce petit jeu un peu d'intérêt.

Enfin, ça donne tout de même un peu l'occasion de faire un travail d'observation même si le hazard permet de facilement en terminer les trois quarts, d'où ma lutte contre le sommeil. Seuls quelques uns m'ont demandé d'y revenir à deux fois, en même temps j'ai aussi choisi des heures pas très matinales pour m'y mettre, ceci explique peut-être cela !

author: {'steamid': '76561198252242594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1524927389}
review:
Maze through a mobius strip!!!

Hocus, a unique mind bending puzzle game where one travels through mazes of 3d objects with only one continuous face. Requiring perplexing alterations to one's spacial reasoning to not randomly stumble through each of the puzzles. But in solving each of the puzzles brought both the sense of acheivement and improved intellegence which felt all the more rewarding.

Cleverly solve or leisurely move through each puzzle, I would recommened this game to anyone.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198148974052', 'num_games_owned': 609, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1478960638}
review: [h1][b]В комлекте с этой игрой должен идти новый мозг, а то свой ломаешь уже после 10 уровня[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198087107037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1479288668}
review:
Полчаса поиграл - прошел пол-игры (вторая половина игры сложнее). Но интересно. Обещают новые уровни.

Больше подойдет, конечно, для телефона, пораскинуть мозгами, пока в дороге, например.

Из-за подсказки о возможных направлениях движения головоломки можно пройти перебором, но интереснее, конечно, самому в уме решать. Простой способ - "размотать" в уме с конца.

2016/11/11 Заметил, что добавили уровни, ачивки и карточки. Обзор, что выше актуален для первых 65 уровней, сейчас их стало примерно в полтора раза больше (100 штук ровно). Не уверен, что они стали сложнее, но играть интересно. Между делом.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009417952', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1478809769}
review:
Joven videojuego de rompecabezas sumamente entretenido.

Aún algo verde y en crecimiento, próximo estreno de nuevos niveles y un editor, tiene sin duda muchísimo potencial.

Mejorando pequeños detalles como el menú y la configuración —que es mínima—, y con el apoyo de la comunidad (mediante la creación de niveles) puede convertirse en un gran pasatiempo.


P.D.: imposible no pensar en el famoso videojuego para [i]smartphones[/i] [b]Monument Valley[/b].

author: {'steamid': '76561198116073531', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1482199200}
review:
Good shit, manI Any interactive medium based on Escher's works is enough excuse to buy it by itself. I'm not saying make some shitty Escher-inspired game that runs worse than a legless grandpa and sell it. You'll be torn to shreds with shitty reviews and endless shame. So, don't do that. Actually do it so I can make fun of you and egg your house.

But this Escher game is pretty sweet and on point. It's simple. It's not perfect (I'd like a 'quit' button in the main menu, and a simplistic view mode that only shows you the puzzle you're currently trying to get through, instead of showing you the previous one you just beat plus the next one on the sides), but it's worth your time. 

You just move a little red cube around some crazy ass designs man that will spin your brain juices around til it hurts. Though this game suggests using a gamepad, just pointing and clicking where you want the cube to go feels absolutly fine. Yet my left hand sits over my WASD keys just craving for some love... she'll be fine though. And keep your Xbox controller in your mom's underwear drawer where it bloody belongs. Fuck that shit.

60+ puzzles with more to come. Even after completing most of them you still won't know what the fuck is going on. That's life right there, bro. That's life. 

Move on. 

And if you place Hocus high, well then.... 

Plus I don't like how this is the only game in my library with the first letter in the title being lowercased. Hurts me eyes. That's such a weak complaint, though. I guess it's alright. Maybe that's just another way they're fucking with us. Damn... getting fucked with by these guys without even having the game open... come to think of it, I like that. 

Nice work, fellas. Hocus, I mean hocus, is worth a buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067198747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1452899816}
review:
Es un juego de perspectivas escherianas en el que la dificultad consiste en poder llegar de un punto a otro siguiendo los caminos que se abren con las perspectivas.

Puede ser un poco basto para alguien a quien no le causen adicción este tipo de juegos, ya que no tiene gráficos amigables, una buena ambientación ni música demasiado destacable. Si es tu caso  quieres probar un juego de puzzles quizás algo más estilo The Bridge sea lo tuyo.

Los puzzles son interesantes y, aunque puedes jugarlos a ciegas, con el paso de los niveles se hace más necesario ir previendo lo que va a pasar si te aventuras por un camino y donde está el punto que va a evitar que te quedes moviéndote en bucle.

La longitud no es mucha, si bien los creadores prometen un editor de niveles y nuevos niveles "coming soon". Sin embargo, por los 2€ que cuesta te entretiene un par de horas. No es mal ratio de precio/entretenimiento.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970901066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1452221497}
review:
Hocus is a great puzzler, one that benefits greatly from the developer’s commitment to the game and the community that has cropped up around it. The minimalistic stylings are a perfect fit for this kind of game, focusing you directly on the challenge at hand. The puzzles themselves are no trifle either and are sure to provide a challenge for even the most non-linear thinkers among us. If you’re looking for another time killer for your phone or just enjoy a good non-Euclidean styled puzzler then Hocus is definitely a title you should check out.

Read my full review here: https://www.therefinedgeek.com.au/index.php/2016/01/08/hocus-you-cant-trust-your-eyes/

author: {'steamid': '76561198168687436', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1575242060}
review:
Nettes kleines Spiel. Das Ziel ist einfach: Finde zur rot markierten Stelle auf der Figur. Überall, wo sich die Stangen in der Ansicht kreuzen, kann man von einer zur anderen wechseln. Zum Spielen wird ein Controller empfohlen, und diese Empfehlung kann ich nur weiter geben. Alternativ geht auch ein Touchscreen. Mit der Maus macht es hingegen keinen Spass. Das Spiel eignet sich gut für zwischendurch, wenn man mal wenig Zeit hat. Derzeit gibt es 65 Levels, 10 weitere werden in kürze versprochen. Aber erwartet nichts Grosses, nach weniger als zwei Stunden hat man es durch.
Spielzeit: 1.9 Std.
Nachtrag: Seither sind noch zahlreiche neue Levels dazugekommen, Achievements und Sammelkarten wurden hinzugefügt und es gibt einen neuen Level-Editor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994894769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1487968032}
review:
I usually get grumpy about mobile games getting ported to Steam, but I also have a soft spot for optical illusions and games based on them.

Hocus has a simple premise and is easy to start playing. Player input consists only of choosing which direction to move the red cube in an effort to guide it to the exit (or is it the entrance?). Once a direction is chosen, the cube moves until it reaches a junction, where it waits for your next instruction. There is no camera movement, because the fixed perspective is essential to the puzzle.

The early levels are simplified to get you accustomed to the rules. Later levels are more complex, but not necessarily more [i]difficult[/i]. The only real downside with this kind of game is that since movement is necessarily limited to six possible directions, it becomes more of a 3D maze than a puzzle as many would think of it (I am totally fine with this, though). There are a few sections (especially in late levels) wherein many joints have only 2 available directions, and you spend more time moving/waiting than thinking/deciding. Most levels have more than one path to the exit, though the last few steps are usually fairly specific.

The splash screen states that the use of an analog gamepad is recommended, but I had a much easier time controlling the game by clicking with my mouse.

I've seen a few people get bent out of shape over the price difference between this version and the mobile version. Here are some solutions:
[list]
[*]Buy it through your mobile device's app store
[*]Buy it through Steam when it is on sale
[*]Shut up
[/list]

I've also seen a few complaints about how the actual game takes place in portrait mode (common practice for games that start out as mobile) with wide border sections on the left and right. This is evident to anybody who either watched the video or looked at the screenshots. In the actual game, the "empty" space is taken up by a slightly blurred version of the preceding and subsequent puzzles. This fact has no impact on the gameplay, and I think that using raw screenshots would have confused shoppers, as there would appear to be three puzzles on screen at once. Personally, I would have preferred solid white space on the sides, both for added focus on the puzzle at hand, and to fit in with the minimalist/tranquil aesthetic. 

Additional levels will be added (at least 10 have been announced so far), and I assume they'll be around the same difficulty as the existing late-game levels.

It's a short, inexpensive puzzle, and I enjoyed it.

₦ out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198014161697', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1454146806}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012696724', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1452002414}
review:
[u]Hocus[/u] has that unique sense of indie puzzle game that we indie puzzle lovers search for in these weird and enchantingly beautiful games. 

It is a small game, make no mistake, and one propably won't be spending dozens of hours in this game, but that precious time that we marvel at the geometric beauties and puzzles, is well worth the money spent into it.

EDIT: It seems that the developer is making more puzzles for our enjoyment (at the bottom of the puzzle-list in-game there is a text "More levels soon...").

3.75 out of 5 red cubes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988012862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1450333601}
review:
Simple labyrinth.

Looks cool, plays meh. The game presents a simple labyrinth that you have to navigate; as should be obvious from the screenshots, there aren't that many branches, so the labyrinths are rather simply structured, if nicely presented. I spent ~2 hours to solve all 65 of these. The problem with this is that this would've taken even less time if the game wasn't so very slow. And I'm not even talking about the 5-second wait as you select a level that is spent watching some simple 2D animation, I'm talking about watching the red cube trundle along with an annoying electronic sound. You see, the cube moves automatically along any leg of the labyrinth once you set it in motion with a swipe of the mouse or a flick of the joystick, because unless it is at a branch it can't go anywhere else anyway, but while you can think 3 turns ahead easily, you have to watch the cube actually complete the journey. Slowly. Which bores me a lot, in fact so much so that I can only take this game in small doses or I'd get the urge to smash things.

I suspect this slowness was introduced to hide the fact that there isn't really a lot to the labyrinths - if you could just swipe the cube along the legs quickly, you'd just as quickly blast through the game, which wouldn't be a problem if it had 200 levels or only cost less than a dollar (which it did in the sale). 

So why would you want to play this? Besides looking cool, the labyrinths are really rather simple (so far, anyway, like I said I've completed 40 of 65), which means there isn't really any feeling of accomplishment that would offset persisting through the annoying slowness of the game which thus becomes its fatal flaw. 
Unless you want to show off by playing something that looks more like modern art than a game, there's no reason to buy this -- and if you do, you really ought to get it for your smartphone, shouldn't you?

author: {'steamid': '76561198076721797', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1562956334}
review: Pretty simple puzzle game, it's essentially a 3D maze. Based around impossible shapes and the like and the game is basically treated as if everything that looks like it could touch is touching, so the puzzle becomes figuring out which sequence of moves gets you to the goal. It's a fun mechanic for a while, but after 65 levels of it, felt a little tiresome and repetitive. Apparently more levels are planned too, though I doubt I'd revisit this game to play them. Sound is minimal but pleasant. For a low price (a dollar or under) I'd imagine this would be worth the money and apparently it's on the app store so I'd say buy it there unless you can get it really cheap here. But it's a decent enough puzzler, for sure, if not a bit basic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097528163', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1500215294}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198208263932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1710752332}
review:
GREAT game. This game has brought me more fun than most puzzle games where they are either too simple or mind-numbingly hard. This game is just a fun perception puzzle game that mixes the hard and easy to create that "Ah Ha!" moment right as you finish the levels. The fact that it might get a level editor is just plain amazing, and makes it alone right now is better, in my opinion, than a lot of small puzzle games I see on steam.The developers are pretty active and listen to the community and the concept is simple, but complex and creative at the same time. It is a type of game that you can play over and over again, and the fact that it is $2 makes that game a pretty good deal. The music is very comforting and relaxing, while the puzzles can sometimes leave you thinking. The animations are pretty smooth and the game is just very pleasing to look at. I Recommend this game for anybody bored and wanting to have maybe hours of fun for a low price.
10/10

review:
Pros:
Really interesting puzzle game. The concept is fairly well illistrated in the videos but it gets a LOT more complicated than what they show.

Cons:
The IOS version is actually cheaper than the steam version and they are exactly the same game in terms of levels. The only difference between this port and the IOS version is the possibility to use a controller and a (sort of) bigger screen. The controlls really don't matter and the screen is still stuck to the odd ratio of an iPhone screen. 

Buy this on sale or on the app store.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053422627', 'num_games_owned': 2391, 'num_reviews': 1237, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1448008400}
review:
Here is my First Impressions and Review video of this game: (To just see my review scoring, move to 26:40)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hRpYRswBm0g&feature=youtu.be

Main Question:  Is "Hocus" a game YOU will like?  

Well, let's ask some questions shall we?  Start at 0, and ask yourself the following questions:

Q #1) What do you think of M.C. Escher's art?
- If you LOVE it, add +7
- If you Like his art, add +4
- If you don't know who M.C. Escher is or don't like his art, add nothing.

Q #2) Do you like casual puzzle games that have simple mouse controls and get more difficult as you progress?
- If you say "HELL YES!".. then add +12
- If you say "Ehh, sometimes they are cool".. then add +7
- If you say "Not really, sometimes but rarely".. then add +3
- If you say "Naw" or "Hell No!".. then add nothing.

Q #3) Do you enjoy trying to solve fancy labyrinths that get pretty complex the more you solve?
- If you say "OMG, I LOVE MAZES!" then add +10
- If you say "Ehh, sometimes they are fun".. then add +6
- If you say "Not too much but they can be okay".. then add +3
- If you say "Nope" or "Who the hell wants to solve a dumb maze?".. then add nothing.

SCORING TO DETERMINE IF YOU SHOULD BUY THIS OR NOT:

- Scored 24 or more total points?  .. Then this game is a "MUST BUY!" for you!  ;-) 
- Scored 17-23 total points? ..Then chances are you will really like this game!
- Scored 11-16 total points? ..Ehh, you might like it for about 10 minutes, but probably not a recommended game for you.
- Scored 0 to 10 points? - Naw, I'd look for a different game, unless you catch it on like a '90% off' sale or something.

My personal review score from the video above I posted is a 79%.  Watch my video to see how I scored it.  :-)

review: Nicely done, even as an obvious mobile port; display is plenty sufficient for its needs (but resizing display would be nice).  Levels are too easy, as I've already solved all of them, and eagerly await new ones and perhaps a level editor.  So it's also quite addictive; highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096720137', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1449690394}
review: I dont take the time to write reviews, but in this case, I will send my gratitude to the developer on this visually stunning gem. Its a simple, but brilliant concept to use the Escher-type of perspective illusions as a game surface. It will be a real shame when the levels end, but MY what a great ride it has been!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079883167', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1473172572}
review:
I do recomment.

I have been waiting for hocus to be greenlit because I don't have an iOS device. If you like mind-bending puzzle games, you will definitely like this one. I like it, becasue I can't see the solution path with one look, and I try a little to find the path.

With an analog gamepad it is preaty easy to use. I wish I could play with my keyboard but I guess the perspective doesn't allow that. The mouse or touch screen does just fine.

I'd say price is very affordable, considering the hours of puzzles I am getting.

I guess only downfall is that the game doesn't scale when I go fullscreen. I am sure the developer is aware of it and has a pretty good reason not to scale.

Can't wait for expension packs :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037165091', 'num_games_owned': 1068, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1479870630}

author: {'steamid': '76561198240304434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1447902899}
review: Ok game but I can't recommend mostly due to the fact that it currently sells for less than a dollar on the app store.  THat's fine if the game is upgraded at all but it doesn't even take up the whole screen.  Instead it's a little window in the center as if the game is supposed to be made for an iphone 5 held vertically- which it clearly was.  The screenshots don't make this clear by the way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041660104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1453676341}
review:
It's a fun game for a low price.  It's obviously a port from mobile, but oh well, it's playable.

The influence from Monument Valley is obvious, but it manages to do its own thing with the concept.  In fact, I'm enjoying this a bit more than Monument Valley.

Though the graphics are lacking (almost completely), in Hocus, the intrigue of the perspective-twisting mechanic is given more room to breathe, freed from Monument Valley's ham-handed attempts at world-building in this emerging genre that is inherently poorly-suited to real, meaningful world-building.

Hocus does one thing and does it well, so I guess you could say it follows the Unix philosophy

author: {'steamid': '76561198241309916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1447901097}
review: Very cool concept but I wouldn't say it's actually fun.  Missing that addictive element that I like in other puzzle games.  Maybe I just have a hard time with the contradictory images but this just isnt doing it for me.  Ill update my review if my op9inion changes.  As others have said, thsi is an obvious mobile port.
